title: Hotel Sahara
address: Hotel Sahara No.(414/A) , 80th Street , Between 26th and, 27th St, Township
descriptions: Straightforward rooms & a mixed-gender dorm in a casual hotel offering dining & free breakfast.
user_reviews:

The free buffet breakfast with fresh tea and coffee make it one of the best deals in central Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Êú®Â≠êÈòøÂäõÈ∫ªÈáå","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVaCuFnS-OnXQUYrxmbiY7HOeBz9OnCl843MZR8OT_INNhWpMk=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The Wi-Fi was good and although it went out a few times, it came back after a few seconds. The only downside was that when I was showering, I had to keep pressing a switch to get the water to come out, otherwise it would cut out.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipO6UeOqkLgAfmGVIjr-aDFoM0aUFfY1ps6ghOco&fid=0x0:0xd860312f0e7fb55b"],"When":"2024-12-30"},{"Name":"Rik Ordonio","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUHGlssdXfyBrK92Tr95XkviuloZbVhr6pxktzc_3Gfb64DfZj3=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I had an extremely disappointing experience at this hotel due to the unprofessional and condescending behavior of the lady at the reception. Upon check-in, she demanded a document or authorization to travel, citing their hotel policy. Despite explaining my situation as an ASEAN citizen, allowed to stay for up to 14 days without such documentation, she remained insistent. Please note that I stayed at hotels in Yangon and Bagan during this trip and  no one asked me about additional documents during check in process. I only had to show my passport with the immigration stamp.

After an unnecessary delay, she presented me with a blank document, insisting I sign it for submission to immigration. When I refused, she responded with condescension, pushing me to comply with an annoyed demeanor. What appalled me the most was her veiled threat, implying that I needed to behave "if [I] don't do anything/something bad," which I found utterly inappropriate and offensive. In the end, she gave up and said go ahead and fill up the form and sign. I explained I don't sign blank documents and will write my personal details before I sign.

Despite my grievances, I must commend another staff member, Ngying Yatu Aung, for his professionalism and genuine concern for my well-being. However, the demeaning treatment I received from the receptionist overshadowed any positive aspects of my stay. I write this review as a cautionary tale to others and advise them to seek accommodations elsewhere. My experience at this hotel was nothing short of horrendous, and it tarnished the remainder of my trip.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Tom Z","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This has been my first stay in Myanmar and I loved it. The room was in the top floor next to a nice roof top terrace with a nice view over the King's palace. The room was equipped with TV, fridge, water cooker and free water, tea and coffee. The bed was comfy and the room itself very quiet. |For breakfast they have buffet with local food but also some scrambled eggs, jam and cake. Also fruits are not missing.|The staff was amazing. Su Su gave me the first instructions about Mandalay and where to go. Very helpful, also the free map they gave me. |So I rented a bike from them and discovered most of the things I wanted to see. Everything was perfect. Service, room, location and especially all of the staff have done a great job. Thank you for your hospitality, I definitely will come back and will highly recommend Sahara Hotel.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Carmen C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeYuXGoFc9HnT35lAJ46cKDIsHY7nNIKUKz_f8yINNlqyrU48jCx-4ctPzihRKgde030w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We arrived after a night bus and the staff and night manager were so helpful and friendly. Check in was quick and easy and the front desk was knowledgeable about what to do in Mandalay with the time we have (we only had 1 day to spend). The manager arranged a tuktuk for us the next day to show us major sites and everything went smoothly. After our long day travelling around mandalay, the same manager gave us a room that we could have a quick shower in before we checked out which we really appreciated. Rooms were cosy and had everything we needed. Great hotel!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Bernarda B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Room was not the biggest, but comfortable enough and quiet so we were able to sleep very well. Brakfast is nice with good choise of food- from local to brad, butter and jam+lots of fresh fruit. ||The location is great, just across the palace and there is a small terrace on the top floor overlooking the palace and Manadalay hill in the distance.||The staff was amazing!!! Very very friendly and helpful. I will definately choose the same hotel on my next trip to Mandalay!!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"h2marti","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfsTQkcy2KndgDISqLavaj05iVMNn3XOI6udcho2AN-fABBAw5poEMIHSoJIZdEEshKkA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed only one night and as it was noisy street life they upgraded my room to give me more sleep. You get greeted with a wet cold towel - no big deal? You will value it after a day in a bus. They gave me tips - and I was thinking ‚Äûupselling‚Äú yet restaurant and tours were good recommendations. Breakfast was fair choices with some local flavours (+ scrambled eggs). After check out storage + a shower after a sweaty day.|Location is good if you like walking (they offered a free bike too), it‚Äôs from facilities pov not ‚Äûthe best‚Äú hotel but very good value for money with amazing / helpful staff that speaks well English","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Lucas BARDY","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKd5bcCSF7S5AynxLuaFnQlM9OiVZ7XfZeQwqxuxjf-LK_WuE6V=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Perfect stay !! We arrived quite early after a night in a bus from Yangon. The staff apologized that our room would only be ready around 10 am, but we were offered to stay in the lobby or just leave the bags and come back later. Once we got back, they informed us that we had been upgraded to a better room ... which was great, really clean, good bed, working A/C, hot shower, complimentary water and everything. The breakfast was good. The best part of our stay was really the staff, who have been amazing to us. Tayzar and his staff were really helpful, and they did everything so our stay was the best possible. Much much recommended !!","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Hotel New Wave Mandalay
address: 80 Street, Between 26&27 Streets, Mandalay 05021
descriptions: Understated rooms & suites in an informal hotel with a rooftop restaurant/bar offering palace views.
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Shiva P","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The hotel bar offers a pleasant atmosphere with cozy seating and friendly staff. However, my recent experience with the pricing of their Nescaf√© coffee left me perplexed. I was charged an exorbitant $5.54 for just two cups of Nescaf√©, which seemed quite unusual for a standard coffee selection.||While I do not seek a refund or an apology, I believe it's essential to suggest to the hotel officials to reassess their pricing strategy for beverages like Nescaf√© coffee. Such overcharging might deter customers from enjoying their time at the bar and could potentially lead to negative reviews.||Apart from this concern, the hotel bar is well-designed and has a great ambiance. I encourage the management to focus on providing fair pricing, which would enhance the overall experience for their guests.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ray Deg","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUqpld2u6Qzgd43Iv7JGDW0aF1n3R7fUh24H46RdD3lYlY0YqH3=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Very nice hotel located in the heart of downtown! We were in room 513 which was spacious and comfortable! The shower was separated from the toilet by a glass sliding door which is not something that can be taken for granted in Myanmar. Most of the time there is no separation between the toilet and the shower. The breakfast was sufficient but could have been a bit better for vegetarian. I liked that they offered eggs on order (including poached eggs). There was a noodle station where you can prepare your own bowl. Cereals and toasts were also on offer alongside with hot dishes (at least one fried rice and other non veg options). There is a beautiful rooftop with comfortable seating and a great bar!
Lastly the staff were impeccable. Most were very well trained and were able to anticipate our needs. The younger staff need more training though.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNIglg-fb6jN7xKtMpOmNp4_fPcJ0J7FzmaAvhd&fid=0x0:0xcf04c1682124c153"],"When":"2019-12-18"},{"Name":"Aaron Khant","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX57fNvweCbbNqoNh48cSkpDUg5r6XtII9yysneCQbQWczWn0tA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Location is spot on near Mandalay Castle so, really can‚Äôt complain. Parking is one big issue and we have late check in cause hotel was servicing both Air Conditions (even though we book this 1 week ahead)

Apart from that, rooms are spacey enough and roof top bar is there for you to chill out with unplugged band.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Aung Moe Oo","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUfvvSyITCh9rQC4izWZetLzYRSIfBCKpuKmrhJSe_g9A-EXTM=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Locate very Closely with Mandalay Palace Old Great Wall. You can see the wall from some of its rooms. Also have roof top with astonishing view of entire city. Room are spacious and very clean. Great Interior Decoration. Price is very reasonable.

Great for the muslims to stay as it is situated right next to a big masjid.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kevin M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Found this place on the 1st time we were in Mandalay because it has a rooftop bar we decided to stay here.||Great decision . Rooms are spacious, clean and great shower. Staff are really brilliant, friendly, helpful and competent. ||Breakfast is also a real hit with a great selection for westerners and Asians. The taxi lads and tuc tuc drivers outside the hotel are sound and the prices very fair.||Rooftop bar is just the hit with a fantastic view of the Mandalay Palace and Mandalay Hill. Rooms do not have a safe but you need a keycard to even get to the floors. ||I would definitely stay here again üòÅ","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nick Thompson","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUHUK0xbfSixVG9fnt0C5pwb6WcMDUUt10g_FT1pkOtge7zVJI=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"I had a very unpleasant experience at this hotel, there are much better options in the area. They gave me a big hassle while checking in and it took a very long time. They didn't have a record of my booking so I had to find my booking reference to prove that I did in fact have a reservation. The "city view" is not a view of the city, but rather the building next door.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Marie B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We were lucky to visit the rooftop bar and restaurant of the hotel the opening night. We were welcomed directly by the hotel owner and his family who glady shared food and drinks with us, even if it was a private family and friends party night. They were nice and wonderful hosts. I believe you can not have a bad stay in an h√¥tel were the owner itself welcome you so well.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Musa Madha","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWkiCSiKuEFkyGSbSUCJd-Ga1vD2J6eN-yIESCe_rlKPH2uaFavPg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"A great hotel for a one night stay with yout family

They didnt provide breakfast when i was staying but did promise to have it next time.
The location is right in the middle of mandalay.
You can see the old Mandalay Palace from the windows.
The service is ok
I asked for an extra pillow and they delivered.
The rooms are nice and cozy
But the aircon in our room wasnt getting that cold.
The bathrooms are also nice with a bathtub","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipO1jsTPwJumuREJYJQy1_6M4udKVUbR6KZbZyA-&fid=0x0:0xcf04c1682124c153"],"When":"2022-5-11"}]

The hotel itself is a bit worn and ‚Äúdusty,‚Äù but this is something you‚Äôll notice across Myanmar, especially with fewer tourists around. Overall, it‚Äôs a pleasant and convenient place to stay.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipP0XvZeSCeSw49wWM7yB6_1MGIoBZiXEBXpqNkQ&fid=0x0:0xa573e4ea0d8294ab"],"When":"2025-1-30"},{"Name":"Trip.com Member","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Very good basic hotel for the price range. On the positives the staff were really friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and the pool and view from the roof is wonderful. The breakfast is also good.

On the negatives, the hotel feels very dated and in big need of a refurbishment. The water takes ages to get hot in the shower, the pressure is low, and the general decor is very dated and a little run down.

While I'm sure it's not like this every day, there was some concert on in the street about two buildings down on a Sunday night, it went on until after 1am with big loud speakers keeping everyone awake. Nothing the hotel could do, but possibly a concern for those sensitive to noise.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sai Mahk Khay","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjURAMGtJ8Ns6seFtg4vrvMbd5npENP44HLf2_5DeX8MGGMR_8Q2=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"best location near downtown with clean room and good service. Great big clean rooms, ginger tea on arrival, welkom drinks in the sky bar, great breakfast included and also a great afternoon tea for free.|But most importantly the service and helpfulness during our stay was outstanding. |In particular ms. All on all a fantastic stay and I could not recommend this hotel highly enough.","Images":null,"When":""}]

Should I ever find myself in Mandalay again, I wouldn't hesitate to consider repeating my visit.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: The Link - 78th

descriptions: Low-key rooms with expansive windows in a relaxed hotel offering an airy restaurant.
user_reviews:

I will back","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Tina Goss","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXedNIn4_AZYXqOCIv2oqhRrQYE2B_6WiSOKSiYi8NyNn6JYNM=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Our family stayed at this hotel and really enjoyed the entire experience. title: Paragon Hotel
address: 65th x 66th St & Ngu Shwe Wah & Khaing Shwe Wah, near Mandalar Thiri, football stadium ocean super centres,, Mandalay
descriptions: Unfussy rooms in an informal hotel offering an outdoor pool & a spa, plus a bar.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanmyathazi","street":"65th x 66th St \u0026 Ngu Shwe Wah \u0026 Khaing Shwe Wah, near Mandalar Thiri, football stadium ocean super centres,","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"amanda j","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdrOaBwvzVCVZGa_JCxmRob18-RTGR2NAc2ehM2ioIFQuUJBtaO6jr7GHqX15LV00VYsw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"On the down side, the hotel is quite shabby. It needs a lick of paint and the curtains and carpet a good clean as well as the furniture. Bedding was fresh. The key pad on the safe didn't work, so I was given a key. The pool water looked cloudy, so I'm not sure how well their filtration system works. I didn't go in. I wasn't given extra toilet roll when the room was made up. ||||It's quite far away from the amenities, so you need to taxi or tuk tuk everywhere. They don't hold any US dollars, but a staff took me to a money changer in a shopping centre which was kind. ||||The upside is that the staff are very nice. The main receptionist helped me alot to organise sightseeing drivers and also my bus to Bagan. I was also given a breakfast lunch box for my bus journey which was sweet. I'm a vegetarian and they prepared extra breakfast items for me every day.||||I give 2 stars for the hotel facilities and four for the staff.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Steffi W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After sleeping on stone mattresses for a few nights we were really greatful for our booking at Paragon Hotel. The beds are new and comfortable, the rooms clean, staff at reception helpful. ||Wifi was a little slow and the water pressure in the shower very low but these were minor issues. ||Unfortunately the hotel is located quite far from the city centre. Hence we had to get a taxi (6-7 $) when we wanted to go out for dinner. ||As the room wasn't expensive (approx 35$ per night) and really comfortable, we didn't mind these extra costs.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ben B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Overall I think this hotel is a good, clean and friendly place to stay within Mandalay. The bedrooms are spacious and very clean and the staff are fabulous. The downside to this hotel is the location. With transport being quite poor for tourists within Mandalay, you have to get an expensive taxi into the centre every time you want to go out. It is about an 90minute walk to the moat around the grounds palace.||||I did enjoy my stay here, however, if transport has not improved since we visited in December 2013 I would recommend staying somewhere a little closer.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Yana W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_hSEOVyYt90T8jEI1lbdGPaVqSrwdtGLOma43xF2tT-AGCQEDWJCQ3qq81gsm_HjiWg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We really liked the hotel and the food in the restaurant. Staff is lovely and the location is good. Close to local market and shopping mall. Hotel is quite modern, rooms are pretty clean but like in many places in Myanmar tininess is not the priority number 1, so we saw some dust and small rubbish around","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Revilo1203","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The hotel is very new and everything is really clean and decent. The rooms are in comparison to other hotels in Myanmar magnificent. The staff is very friendly and try to help wherever there is a problem. The only negative aspect is that the hotel is pretty far away from the city centre. However by renting a taxi or a bike this problem can be solved. I can highly recommend this hotel.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nick C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeNj0UTN0yIrCGyJ0JhWwDODOg5QjAH0gdfB9Ji-oFl0zWFI-YVmhNAr-FGLycdpIjFmw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We were mislead into booking this hotel from the agoda wesbite which incorrectly states this hotel is 600m from the city center. Its not. Its about UD$10 away from the city center by taxi and is in the middle of a residential area with no restaurants or nightlife. The hotel restaurant is fortunately excellent. The staff are a mixed bag - only one could speak english and was excellent at helping us arrange a taxi driver for the day and other items. However the rest of the staff (especially the night staff) could not speak english and answer all questions with 'yes' which is not helpful (and become extremely frustrating after a while, believe me). Plenty of hot water and the wifi was consistent but extremely slow (as it is anywhere in Myanmar).","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ron Koko (Ronkoko86)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV0keSGD_fJXCr8xh6CAHx9rlnoqTnGpm5EuRZIrK8goWKdZkKy=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Good budget hotel, its abit far from city center but you can use grab bike to get around. I wouldnt recomend going out late at night tho. Rooms are decently clean. Some rooms AC is getting old.  Usually have lots of mosquitoes in room but you can ask the staff to spray for you. Ok breakfast. Small size swimming pool. For the price you pay, it's good value..","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Yan Naing Win","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUsi_2ow_Be89dD0P3x1X4d1BbsWPeDedmTRCzMQT2ymVF8MxpZ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great Hotel. They added bath tubs in all of their rooms. They have a pool for customers to have fun. In Myanmar, the electricity sometimes cuts out and when it happens, they always use a generator for electricity.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Kantel Hotel

user_reviews:

title: Hotel Homey Mandalay
address: 64th Street, Between 27th and 28th Street Mandalay, 05021
descriptions: Informal lodging offering a rooftop terrace with city views, plus parking & a breakfast buffet.
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Benny De","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocI8nOgTg1ZQpSISaBRay9EPtl0tCdv3mHU8nX4YtRlziHqKQA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Hotel Homey Mandalay run electricity 24 hours (some hotels are not run the electricity 24 hours)
Room for single person is a bit small but very comfortable, clean and no bed bug.
Staffs are wonderful and very helpful.

Thank you very much !","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sarah B.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWAf2E0u1-dYZ2ruQ6Rbufzf_KJtPOgGXXQ2Ht5manS8kmxo7f7=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"So we stayed at this hotel in October because they accept pets and decided to come back to it in December because it was OK. They charge 5000 kyats per pet which is pretty reasonable. The second time we stayed without the dog, though.

Our last visit was unpleasant. They started ripping off foreigners. Told us some fairy tale about the immigration office not allowing male foreigners to stay with a local female in the same room. Our friend has a local girlfriend and she came to stay with him in his double room. They wanted him to pay 30 000 kyats extra just to register her. We live in Myanmar for years now and travel at least 4 times per year. This was obviously a dirty trick played by their hungry manager. We moved to another hotel where nobody heard of such a thing. We travelled to Bagan and Pyin Oo Lwin right after that and there were no such rules.
In addition to this, they started overcharging us for our laundry, damaged some items, and the smell wasn‚Äôt fresh. It was as though they didn‚Äôt use enough detergent.
At last, the hotel is very noisy and accepts part-time guests. I highly recommend to avoid this place.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipPcyp55FQ9H5uhViNzGY3wimOFwfP8R9q-fekeS&fid=0x0:0xef38d1b194819eaf"],"When":"2024-1-5"},{"Name":"Htun Lwin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUcZnztQfoVzWvdI_lKoaNBIszNK6AX0UotG1w6I2vI6YqwSza8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Affordable Price , 24 hours electric power. title: Bagan King
address: No. 44, Corner of 73rd & 28th Street Chan Aye Tharzan Township, Mandalay, Myanmar 11221
descriptions: Relaxed rooms in an opulent hotel offering a restaurant/bar & a lounge, plus free breakfast.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No. 44, Corner of 73rd \u0026 28th Street Chan Aye Tharzan Township, Mandalay,","city":"Myanmar","postal_code":"11221","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Kenny Ng","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXCPiWSGkGfCXb8GqbRS4EihZp7hXutw5aSYdms6cn3axf1tOyU6w=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Spent two nights here on our holidays and everything was perfect! The location is convenient for touring Mandalay and it is a walking distance to many good restaurants nearby. The entire hotel is uniquely designed, which makes us feel like staying in ancient times Myanmar. As for the room, it was clean and comfortable; the toilet is just wow. Staffs were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Best of all, they have a rooftop bar to view the entire town and free cocktails are served at a certain hour of the day. We would definitely return in the future!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipMS_mnduUhGX8xGbwKT5uxxeubw4a4VMVrb4RyM&fid=0x0:0x5313b295950ae362"],"When":"2019-11-21"},{"Name":"Caroline A","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeYuXGoFc9HnT35lAJ46cKDIsHY7nNIKUKz_f8yINNlqyrU48jCx-4ctPzihRKgde030w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This is a good choice for a short, sightseeing stay in Mandalay as it is near the Royal Palace and everything else.  The room was clean and quite large enough for two friends with their cases, though nowhere to actually unpack clothes except a small hanging rail.   The bathroom was spotless with a good shower - a little more light would have been appreciated, in the bedroom also.   Beds were comfortable, and the service was good.||The best thing about the hotel is the rooftop restaurant where they can slide back the windows to make it more like a roofed terrace.  Great cocktails for Happy Hour and the food was nice.  Can't say I enjoyed the Puppet Show and Music as it just droned on in the background through the evening although the lady puppeteer was, I am sure, very good - sorry, not my thing!!||Breakfasts were particularly good with loads of choice, both Western and Asian - and the only half decent bread we had in Myanmar! Particular merit was a Myanmar flat  pancake, filled with chillies, bean sprouts and all sorts!!||Shame there was no outside area or pool, but it is in the centre of Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Michele P","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"|This hotel is on a corner of two busy streets in Yangon. It‚Äôs rather noisy all day long, with traffic. However, I imagine this may be the same issue for many hotels in the centre of the city.||The rooms were a little over furnished for the size, but was fine for our stay. The bathroom was a good size. ||Breakfast was served on the roof top with far reaching views of the city. Sadly there was very little choice for vegetarians, and so I did not bother with breakfast on my second day.  ||I must mention that the hotel serve free cocktails at happy hour on the roof terrace, which was an unexpected surprise. The team were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Aung Ko Ko. ||We dined there on our first evening, and watched the puppet show that took place each evening. ||What made this hotel was the team (my reason for 5 stars),who were incredibly helpful and attentive. This was from the welcome desk and reception team, to the restaurant and bar staff. ||The reception desk also helped us to find a camera shop and a very reasonable tuk  tuk to take us around the ‚Äúmust see‚Äù sites for the afternoon. We very much appreciated their help and service with a smile.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Schydes","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Only reason we did not give 5-star rating is because it's a busy location in the middle of the Mandalay street grid.  Closer to Irrawaddy River would be better (sunset restaurants and bars, etcetera).  That being stated, if you're in Mandalay to sight-see (citadel, temples, etc.) this place is excellent.  It's like the Goldie Locks hotel:  middle range to everything except the awesome top-floor. Rooms are nice and basic. Not too big, not too small.  Not chintzy, not fancy.  Right in the middle and a good price point.  Walking distance from the citadel, markets and restaurants (or rent bicycles - Mandalay is not too scary to navigate and it's a grid - it's hard to get lost here).  If you fly out of Mandalay, have the friendly front desk staff book you a private driver and leave early so you can visit U-Bain Bridge on way to airport.  Driver will wait for you.  Longest teak bridge in the world!  Best at sunrise or sunset.  Top floor features great views and cocktail bar.  Great breakfast spread up there.  Great dinner too - WITH PUPPET SHOW AND MUSIC EVERY NIGHT!  Front desk even recommended a river-front hotel for us to have sunset drinks one evening.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Barney Smith","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW2Y5Pb0k9ebmasRpn1wCXqKUocMFt92Fs1kK7O6WPetQRSc1TF=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Cracking hotel.

Room was a decent size with old wooden style furnishings and flooring, nice exposed brickwork in the shower, firm bed.

Had a couple of free cocktails each on the house which was a nice touch, good view of Mandalay from the roof bar, mountains and all.

The staff were so lovely  - kind, happy, and extremely helpful. Only stayed for one night but wish we could have stayed longer!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"David S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Just stayed at this convenient and nice hotel for two days before heading back to  Bangkok. Room was nicely furnished with comfortable beds and nice bathroom with great shower. Restaurant was quite nice, too, with good food selection, nice wine menu, and live music and Burmese puppet show. Excellent service staff from our waiter Aung Ko Ko, who was attentive and welcoming.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Brenda D","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed at the bagan King hotel for two nights during our recent trip around Myanmar.  We enjoyed the cooked breakfast in the rooftop restaurant, and the lovely outlook at sunset for the happy hour cocktails, my favourite being the Gin cocktails - delicious.  Bagan King was a great base for us to explore around Mandalay, we had a driver each day so didn‚Äôt spend too much time in the hotel.  Our room was clean and we had a hot shower each night before settling in with the air condition on.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Passport Footnotes","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjULZUoBp4g6ZR2LPRCC8FmQmjl0utStYJhHdH3laOqI3fvfD1w0=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Loved it.  Very classy Myanmar hotel with great staff and excellent breakfast.  We felt like a king and queen here.  The bathroom and shower I want in my own home.. the whole place was bricked and decorated like an Asian palace of old.. just awesome!  And the wifi is excellent....","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Hotel Nova
address: Mandalay
descriptions: Relaxed hotel featuring a restaurant & a lobby lounge, plus a rooftop bar with river views.
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Mike Kumagai","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXikOAYVmUuAosok2H75tGknSphRT9DemyC4-kZqla8FoxZrZR9=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"One of the worst hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at - whatever you do, don‚Äôt stay here. title: Hotel Queen
address: 81 St, bet 32 x 33, Chan Aye Tharzan Township, Mandalay
descriptions: Relaxed rooms in an unpretentious hotel offering free breakfast & Wi-Fi, plus a restaurant/bar.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"81 St, bet 32 x 33, Chan Aye Tharzan Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Sarah B.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWAf2E0u1-dYZ2ruQ6Rbufzf_KJtPOgGXXQ2Ht5manS8kmxo7f7=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We came here a few times for dinner at the rooftop bar and restaurant. The food is good and the prices are reasonable. The drinks  are also fine. I like their fresh juices. They don't cheat, at least. The service is great!\nWe tried their swimming pool as well. It's a nice one if you don't come on a holiday.\nWe never stayed at the hotel itself but will do soon just to check out their rooms.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNte_ejwWYWXwpF_oLCt9rX7g5Y1ck3woURe7MA\u0026fid=0x0:0xed27a35e3b5555d7"],"When":"2021-12-10"},{"Name":"craig M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QejddW0yoGeT8LnCjh-OGQgsf6YKqhof3HZA5-um4yCkQej85oCdMUmKPJmnowcu5Ag5w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I have to agree with the observations of the poster below. An excellent choice in Mandalay.||||I have stayed 4 times over the last 4 years, each time staying between 4 and 7 nights. When travelling with my wife we pay that little extra for a Queen Suite. They are spacious, well furnished and a great choice.  In February, when I was by myself on business (starting a little importing), I took a Superior room for 7 nights which was perfect with a good desk to do some work and their Wi-Fi is also quite good. ||||I should remark on some of the previous reviews. The complaint about the loud disco was for Valentine‚Äôs Day!  The Sky View bar is normally quite sedate and perfect for a nightcap. I have never had a problem with the hot water. The ‚ÄúHorror Visit‚Äù review is definitely not this hotel. The reception is on the ground floor on a main road, not an alley, and with a doorman always in attendance. ||||I really like the location. There is a good beer station on the corner of 32nd street, the ‚ÄúGolden Spider‚Äù, they do a great dried goat salad, ‚Äòset dah chow‚Äô,  which is a perfect accompaniment to a few beers. A couple of blocks down you have ‚ÄúAye Myit Tar‚Äù  a superb traditional Burmese curry restaurant and another block further ‚ÄúSuper 81‚Äù with Chinese BBQ on the ground floor, an air-con  room on the 1st floor and open air rooftop further up, all offering their excellent a la carte Chinese food. And this is all for a bit of variation on the great food at the Queen‚Äôs own restaurant. ||||I would have no hesitation recommending the Queen to any one visiting Mandalay, in fact my wife and her sister are be checking in tomorrow for 4 nights.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ben R","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I was very happy to stay at the hotel. The staff were the highlight, very helpful and friendly. I received great recommendations on where to go, shop, eat and sightsee, and they were even able let me check out late. Thank you for a great time, I feel refreshed having stayed here :)||||The bed was nicely firm, and the pillows were good, bedding was OK. Bathroom quality is much better than expected for Myanmar, and the building has pleasant city views. Bike rental was free and good enough. Rooms are bright and well air-conditioned, and the blackout curtains are good. ||Thanks again!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"dasabooks","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QchZeuqqdsc2mxTzAL46o1Zp-eQpx0fXItgIlFx_-eADsDQzpyjY9GuirM6XH9EgCdepg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I'm based in Thailand and have been visiting Mandalay at least twice a year for the past decade plus. I tried several other hotels before finally discovering the Hotel Queen on 81st Street. I like the location, but more importantly I like everything about the hotel. The rooms are reasonably priced, coming with working AC, hot water (something that some hotels are lacking!), a good choice of cable TV channels, and that all important generator (for the times when the power goes out --- still a frequent happening in Myanmar!).||||In addition to those factors, the staff at hotel are fabulous. The workers at the front desk are always very polite and helpful, and the guy in charge of housekeeping and room service, Kyaw Zin Tun, always goes out of his way to make sure that my requests are handled. Kudos also to the restaurant on the top floor. They offer a very good buffet breakfast. I'm not one of those Westerners that like a Western breakfast (hey, I'm in Myanmar, I want to eat the local food!) so appreciate the range of noodles and rice dishes, especially their excellent monhinga. Very tasty! I've also dined there for lunch and breakfast and the entr√©e dishes are also of very high quality. They also have a very good band that plays there in the evening. ||||What more can I say about this fine hotel? They offer free bicycle rentals to guests, have wi-fi in the rooms (or a computer downstairs that you can use), have a travel agent with money exchange service in the lobby, and offer the sort of friendly personal service that is so common in Myanmar. The Hotel Queen honestly feels like a home away from home.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Philipp Molzer","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVwxEtyfZ2xdvtsQWaXKFUOPGtOkbWliN26WEP5xVcGuOUV9Mkg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Good deal for the price.  Large room with clean sheets on firm mattress.  Water in shower takes a while to heat up.  Big free breakfast buffet is quite good and has real coffee.  The parking is in front of hotel with a security guard.  Many staff speak English and all are friendly and helpful.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"parkerlhs","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfzjVLsS8e-67WTk0n2dtmoLvjFzQd1pnSZl8AzVxF0EXF41tQWWb2Gu3UnsT1rmBrWdQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My husband and I usually stay at more budget type accommodations but I had my 75 year old father in law with us, so we needed something nicer and more comfortable. Hotel Queen was a very nice choice. We had a simple double room that was more than adequate and my father in law had a suite which was quite large and nicely furnished. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and the hot water was plentiful. They have a nice restaurant on top and they serve a great breakfast buffet. I especially liked the ever changing noodle station. Wifi is pretty standard for Myanmar. The location is good, there is a really great traditional Myanmar restaurant very close by. We also used their tour services and hired a driver to take us around the area, and also to take us to Si Paw. The prices are very reasonable and I recommend Mr. Nay Win Han as your driver. He is extremely safe and very considerate.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Askalu G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Overall it was just cozy and all about amazing. The best part of my experience there is the infinity pool which is rare to see in most downtown hotels like this and of course the breakfast is also very nice and delicious. Staffs are welcoming, warm and most importantly so helpful. Definitely will stay there again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Khen Solomon Lethil","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXvsj8iS1asJnHN8FdU3b4DsjoCpoQejCTOY79izgTqV0cp8d43hA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Its quite Okey in here. Rooms are large enough, clean and cool. Customer services are pretty nice (helping, smiling) and its almost free likes back home. Hotel complimentary is very general practical, basically drinking water that's it! Hotel has got it own dinning hall, bar (little bit western style). Oh yes... the bathroom has got separated toilet and shower... but gotta stand on the bathtubs when showering... the view and noise are a bit weird ? I gave it 3 out of 5 stars...","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: The Home Hotel
address: 427/5, 82nd Street, Between 32nd & 33rd Street, Chan Aye Tharzan Township, Mandalay
descriptions: Understated rooms in a relaxed downtown hotel featuring free breakfast, Wi-Fi & loaner bikes.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"427/5, 82nd Street, Between 32nd \u0026 33rd Street, Chan Aye Tharzan Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Julia B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIQM8pcr2YJJr81IfwupDZCY58WwFNxsi-uchOs2gtPZSJuXg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We were very happy with our choice of \"The Home Hotel\". There were some power cuts as everywhere in Myanmar, but the hotel fixed it with their generator in short time so AC was running all night if needed. the bed was on the firm side but comfortable enough to have a good night‚Äôs sleep. New bathroom with good shower. Highly recommended.\nUpdate: also our second stay was very good. Breakfast has a lot of choices. Central location and Tuktuks readily available for short trips to all central Mandalay sightseeing, restaurants etc. Staff is professional and very helpful. Would always book again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Phoo Aung","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIv4zcdv40znJss_10eQHrS45oRujrqzpCo1RXgvEH5Y6emrQ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Bed and comforter quality is good. Housekeeping is well done and the shower's water pressure is satisfying. The breakfast spread is decent and the roof top restaurant offers an awesome view.\nIf you are smell-sensitive like me, ask for a non-smoking room as some rooms have cigarette smell from the previous dwellers.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipPuerD8ih8tXMJE3WaaGN2qMJDpECooQ-3dZ1eN\u0026fid=0x0:0x1be1b205e294c31a"],"When":"2022-9-26"},{"Name":"z z","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJeI16JDT85T0eUuW4r77XQm1OeDllFVQV7qj9PTn_x44pnBQ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"superb view from the restaurant and corner room. English speaking professional staff from the front to the bell. 24hrs electric w/  1-2 mins swap. great English and international Hollywood movies. clean, roomy, nice room. great variety and good breakfast.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipMQcTdebdUup4_t1VaZlIIHZgYnepWBrGGpvkMj\u0026fid=0x0:0x1be1b205e294c31a"],"When":"2023-7-8"},{"Name":"touristmouse","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeqQESQs2CRf2VRyln1Raq0k2FSdB19mGKme5Xh6nHXcs2V7pTrOayJAdxC-qWdu9VyTA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed in a Deluxe Double room on level 3 for 4 nights. Check-in is fuss free but Check out took a while as they could not locate my laundry bill initially. Although the staff spoke limited English, they are always warm and helpful.||||The best feature of this hotel is perhaps the shower pressure. It is by far the best among the 3 same star hotels I stayed in myanmar trip. The bed is so comfortable. The hotel is located along a main street which is not really busy so noise is not an issue even though I'm staying. There are however, renovation going on inside and construction works outside during the day. You‚Äôll be fine so long you don't intend to take an afternoon nap. ||||The cable TV channels available may have revealed the guests profile. 90% of the channels are mainland chinese channels (with no english subs) appealing to mature groups. The other channels include 1 Thai channel, 1 bollywood channel, 1 football channel  and TV Monde 5. An English news channel would have been nice. ||||The hotel breakfast buffet is really basic and there‚Äôs always a queue at the egg station, but it sufficient to kickstart the day. There are some food kiosks across the streets. However, I am not keen to tackle the chilly weather and tricky traffic early in the morning so I stick to the restaurant for my entire stay. As an added bonus, you can watch the sunrise from the hotel restaurant as it features an unblocked view of Mandalay city. Pity the restaurant is closed after breakfast. Power outages are fairly common in Myanmar and I experienced it a few times on 2 days but the power will come back within minutes. WiFi connection is generally great most of the time but may be choppy for a while after each power outage.||||The hotel also helped me to engage a driver for Pyin Ow Lwin which I totally enjoyed the trip. The only negative thing I have to say is the housekeeping team really need to buck up. They missed a cup sitting on same spot unwashed for 3 days and on the last day, they missed my making up my room altogether. Nonetheless, they swiftly delivered my towels and water bottle after I called.||||I booked the hotel via a flash deal.For the price I paid, I think the hotel does offer value for money.||||Tips:  ||Taxi from Hotel to Airport cost 30,000 kyat if you get the hotel to arrange for you but it will only cost 14,700 kyat if you use Grab App to hail Taxi. ||||If you are on a budget, check out Shan Ma Ma which is only 6-7 minutes walk away from the hotel. Crossing road in Myanmar is tricky though.||Alternatively, the slightly pricer BBQ restaurant 99 with helpful staff is really nice too.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Esther T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcHdm0oAuHtzPwzcwUtTqUfPbZXmYnyyN78cO7_Z2aHVLpBkIuu0olTbSpOuQZcPV9sYQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The staff are very helpful and friendly,speaks good English. The room is spacious and clean with room service available.||||We stayed one night before taking bus to inle lake and coming back at 4 plus am to the same hotel. The staff was nice enough to let us check in early. ||||Also, had a bit of issue with the mosquito everywhere in Mandalay and the staff went the extra mile to help me burn the coil to put in the room.||||Kudos to the team ! Will come back again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Magda L","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed 3 nights in The Home Hotel and had a relaxing stay. The room itself was confortable and clean and the staff was kind and friendly all time. They helped us to get a tuk tuk when no one was around and also with the cancellation of our flight. But the most amazing experience were the 2 1/2 day trips with Ko Yar. He is an excellent driver and has shown us all the beautiful places in and around Mandalay (he's speaking English very well!!). Due to these great trips we decided to go with him to Inle Lake instead of flying and are really thankful for this decision. Don't forget to ask the reception for a trip with him when you are around!!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Paul W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The hotel is centrally located in Mandalay. Comfortable. Big rooms and good air-conditioning.|We highly recommend driver and guide Mr Ko-Yar who is associated with The Home Hotel. |His car is comfortable and he is polite and helpful. |Mr Ko-Yar took us for a day tour around Mandalay and also drove us to Bagan. They were great experiences. He is a careful driver. He also does airport transfers too.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Berit Sletbakk B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Home hotel has very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are clean and nice. I had a comfortable stay.|The highlight was that the hotel arranged a wonderful guided tour with Mr. Ko Yar,he took very good care of me for 2 days in Mandalay and Bagan. He showed me the historic and scenic sights, but most memorable was all the local insights in to culture and daily life in Myanmar. He answered all my questions and took very good care of me during my visit. Highly recommend him to anyone visiting Mandalay for a special and beautiful visit. His number is +959798716442","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Hotel by the Red Canal
address: No. 417 corner of 63 and, 22nd St, Mandalay 00952
descriptions: Upmarket lodging offering stylish rooms, an Indian restaurant & a bar, plus a spa & an outdoor pool.
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Kyaw Zin Tun","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUZdNSaWuTsy8s0sNM2ABtOoS9GS_5obhhDzSWj_7WwXBkFHHXz=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Reached to there, I liked room style and lightning and surrounding area keep silence and good privacy but something happened in hotel some customers are shouting outside, some rooms are not soundproof need to be repaired for that (positive thinking).","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Krzysiek Z","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"very unique boutique hotel with exceptional design. the Stuff speaks good English,  specially 2 girls in recepetion  Mi and Thae which are extremely hulpful! And the kitchen manager. all the People in the hotel are nice and open, we loved them. Beds are very comfortable. try to book the room with wooden carvings, you will feel like a maharad or a Pagan King ;) we honestly recommend!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"eab2124","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdDVsOCeofRZJ7E-5_OmGTopxhKLKgrRyRiBqSVIkkG6ZY8A0xH5cj33o1mJn3HSwPBIA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"There aren't many hotel options at Mandalay at the moment so we stayed in this pretty hotel. Problem is, it's double the prices of most of the other hotels around Mandalay, the rooms are small and urgently in need of renovation. The pictures online really over-sell the glamor of the hotel which is nicely done-up but basically just an average building with a small pool and an average restaurant. Breakfast can be brought to the room but it arrived cold and was of middling quality. The bathtub had scrapes and the hotel forgot to turn on the hot water until they were specifically asked (due to lack of guests, I suppose). Staff, particularly restaurant staff, are super friendly and they gave us a good deal on an airport taxi- and until the tourism industry recovers, this may still be your best choice in Mandalay, at 2x the price it should actually cost...","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Scott N","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"A great escape from the outside. Rooms are gorgeous, the food is super tasty in a well designed Cafe, nice outside swimming pool, and the staff are friendly and really helpful.  Honestly, Mandalay is dirty and unkempt so I find myself hanging around the hotel after days tours.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"JeromeJi","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel is absolutely overpriced for the service you get!||Rooms despite of being nice are old equiped, with mid range bed sheets and pillows. ||||No shower! only a bath in the bathroom and 20mn to get warm water in the morning! Toilet in the same small bathroom...||||Staff are nice but doesnt speak good english, ask you for an exact breakfast timing but are not ready to serve it on time; services provided were aceptable but again overpriced compare to what you can get by yourself.||Location is good nevertheless and you can go walking distance to some interesting places around.||Pool is small but nice. Surrounding Environnement is normal, Garden is beautiful.||In brief what you get in this hotel should simply be paid half of the price at least!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"jackiemat","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_m0BOt0e288CC5xVhlFJeGbeLoq1HoB7h5IAKHAwOrWyFaFWxIwsJ8EDSK3zkB1-qng=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We very much enjoyed our stay here. Our room was good with a small terrace facing the pool area. Complimentary cocktails by the pool in the evening with traditional music were a nice touch. The Indian food in the restaurant  was very good and inexpensive. Staff very pleasant and we would definitely return.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Lynn S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The service, room, and grounds were impeccable. From the hand-carved wood on the ceilings, walls, and furniture to the peaceful pond and its water flowing by my private porch, every detail was well thought out. We did not realize all there is to do while in Mandalay. Ms. Myat Noe, who works at the reception desk, was particularly helpful in suggesting, booking, and arranging transportation to several local \"must-sees\" to including a Marinette performance and several local sites. The food in the hotel's restaurant was very tasty and the service was excellent. The food selection is slim, so we did venture out to several excellent restaurants in the area. Also, for those who what to know, COVID was addressed. All staff wore masks and room cleaning was offered with protocols in place.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Thein M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Stayed in the hotel for a couple of times from room to room. One of my favorite room is located in the ground floor with outdoor bathroom. Once you entered the lobby, the pleasant aroma (sandalwood) was waited for you just to relax. Another favorite part is the dinning place where free breakfast is served. There is a free cocktail pool side party everyday from 6pm to 7pm where guests enjoy traditional Burmese Harp and wine.....Overall a truly an unforgettable experience....","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: 79 Living Hotel
address: 79th street, between 29th &, 30th St, Mandalay
descriptions: Casual rooms & suites in an unassuming hotel featuring a rooftop bar with panoramic city views.
user_reviews: [{"Name":"David ‚ÄúDc‚Äù Calderwood","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW_1vkDuHX_6MObPBUCdfNJZ-pzgjJDczJeXU11LiGOIGpRQro=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Staff were super friendly and accommodating. Mandalay is a quiet place for a westerner but with a bike you can really explore the area. So location wise its easy to find.  Rooms are reflective of the price you pay. Definitely recommend.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Felixdom","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcoKrjftg2H5FSPDgamEji1HcAj6KJIMYEaB28IfM5URISpFokTGJ4TKCMmdB7Et-p_0g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Im trying to change the dates from my Booking and the hotel does not respond, through agoda was useless, 1 hour on the phone to get no info about the possibility of changing dates, you better book with other company and other hotel, its a pity this kind of service","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Lou Cypher","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK3HkMFsvK7QbexT9Vrl4bdF2IhREMw4ZwHoRg9ZjCAJfZCOQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"The hotel has seen better days. Relatively cheap so i wasnt expecting much, the aircon was excellent.  Only local tv channels. Has a reliable generator for power outs. Ample hot water.\nMy main issue was cleanliness. There is a serious lack of attention to basic cleaning. Black mould throughout the bathroom, dirty walls, food scraps from previous guest in bedside table. Ants in kettle,  Safe not bolted down. Sewer smell in bathroom. Although if you leave the bathroom fan on continuously it clears the sewer smell. Dirty stained mattress left in hallway. Breakfast is not worth attending. As it lacks choice and is too basic. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly and are a reliable source of local information. I recommend management go though the hotel with a professional cleaning service to correct issues. Then educate staff on how to clean properly. I would stay here again if cleaner.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Florian V","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcoKrjftg2H5FSPDgamEji1HcAj6KJIMYEaB28IfM5URISpFokTGJ4TKCMmdB7Et-p_0g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We had a very nice double bed room, good view over the city. The breakfast buffet was pretty nice. You can choose your eggs the way you like, they prepare then fresh to order. You can book transport without extra charge at the reception. Only downside was that the ac was not powerful enough in our room.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Candy T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeYuXGoFc9HnT35lAJ46cKDIsHY7nNIKUKz_f8yINNlqyrU48jCx-4ctPzihRKgde030w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Me and my frineds made a short trip to Mandalay in October 2018. I think the price of the hotel room is very reasonable. We stayed in a double bed room and it was quite new. Breakfast over there was nice too. They have a small rooftop bar which has a spectacular view of Shan mountain ranges. Convenient to go everywhere since it is situated in the center of the town. Wouldn't mind staying there again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"jim kwan","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLn2CjweN5Hjr97HdZOQsmRtFzBtGy7ALlk0HnBXMSUpI03dA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"I stayed for 2 nights and if you can put up with noises from slightest movements from above and beside, trains from across the street,  noise from the next door elementary school, chanting from the monk on loud speaker at 6 am, and the heavy traffics outside going over the over paths over the train tracks, then it a good place stay for it's value. Room has everything one needs and very tasty breakfast.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Maxime Mangin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIW--bJ1ftQ7hbX9JWQLq6ws8XdFLQm-uyrHK0dILZvoe3rQJk=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Nice rooms, staff very helpful at sll time, they gave us a breakfast bag when we checked out early, they helped us with every detail there on site. I forgot to mention the very nice rooftop and the free cocktail (nice and simple)","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Joseph Barch","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVl1MudQdgAC_LDSG2mf5fksGq_bq2PK4FkmyvMAJautlb1D2D1=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Clean, quiet, comfortable rooms. Food is good \u0026 priced accordingly. Often willing to give discount for room if booked directly through them.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNoxbfzHO7OZSUnbid8o1CcwM7JOUQ9SDau8866\u0026fid=0x0:0xb6d0f6c265a68d4d"],"When":"2018-5-17"}]

You can see the quality of the issued room on the photo.The hotel's diligence to charge 20% on top of any "helping" service is also hilarious. title: Mandalay Lodge Hotel
address: X4M9+8PX Mandalay Lodge Hotel, 58 Steeet, bet 22nd & 23rd street, Aungmyaytharzan Township, Mandalay
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Justin Sarnoski","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKCi8Ol00_-0QxIV6tjJagjHI7v9vO7z0dDfXhlWjJA65dktus=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Amazing building, awesome clean rooms, and super breakfast. Pool is nice and has a good gym and full restaurant. Location is pretty bad tho, it's a brisk walk south to a busy corner to get a ride anywhere.  Also, power cut out once an hour or two. None of these negatives were deal breakers other than the price was still $55 which is pretty high for Mandalay (sister hotel closer to palace was a whoppong $115?!!)","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNbiRsCs0f09Aq4dlJAOLUYhgUWYBRJ6lk95vGn\u0026fid=0x0:0x93eabf9bf2d3ce1f"],"When":"2022-12-21"},{"Name":"Tarn A","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Very professionally run hotel with courteous staff. The room was spacious, clean, with functioning modern conveniences. Our school party loved the swimming pool and gym, and the hotel staff were willing to make accommodations and adapt so that the kids could swim for longer, sing karaoke at the poolside, play chin long and be safe. Only slight criticism would be that the Wi-Fi was sometimes patchy in my room at the end of the corridor and there were cigarette butts on the balcony and at the poolside that were not cleaned up. Otherwise, Nwe Waddy Hotel provides a really excellent level of service.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Thant Z","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Better view on the front site, to the pool and to the mountains in the distance. Staff are friendly and helpful. The only thing for the room is not sound proof especially someone close the door. Pool is nice though not very big. Breakfast is quite simple and the local is a bit far from other points of interest. Though far and being in quite locality, there are some restaurants nearby in walking distance. Recommend for relax, and quite room not far from the city.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Michael B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Stayed here for 2 nights - room OK but bathroom dated and shower was either too hot or too cold. The pool is nice but busy traffic passing close (likely the same for many hotels in Mandalay?). Staff very friendly and helpful but I did find it difficult to communicate - I was looking for a nearby gym to use but somehow this was to tricky to explain and advise. The breakfast waiting staff were dressed in casual demin jackets and sweatshirts over their uniforms which confused me as whether they were staff or guests ? I couldn‚Äôt find the hotel listed as a GRAB taxi location which was annoying. Therefore overall rating 3","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Peter F","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We had 3 nights here and it was good value, with a spacious room snd a great pool. The hotel was busy but quiet, though breakfasts were rather noisy! The staff were outstanding, from the owner down . In particular Kyow Zin Thot couldnt do enough to help us, and front desk lady Thet Hiet San was charming and resourceful.  Overall it was a lovely few days and we would stay there again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sammy M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Nice hotel with a friendly staff, brand new so very clean and everything working well.  Great pool with a couple of jacuzzis alongside, with an additional shallower pool for smaller children.  ||||Wifi worked all the time.  Close to moat and to Mandalay Hill etc.||||English not the strongest but that is made up for with effort and smiles- and we were the first foreigners so let‚Äôs give them time!  Hotel arranged our onward bus travel with collection from the lobby.||||I would stay here again, and I would bring the family next time- great experience in this hotel and the city of Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Paul G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We were recommended the Nwe Waddy Hotel when we landed at Mandalay Airport.It is easy to get to by bus for 4000 kyat or taxi for 15000 kyat.From the moment we arrived we were treated like Royalty.The staff were all very attentive and extremely friendly.They would really go that extra yard to accommodate your needs.They have the most amazing pool that in the morning has the sun and in the evening is shaded but is perfect for an evening dip.There is also a smaller pool that would be ideal for younger children and 2 jacuzzis!! There is a spa and a gym however being a new hotel these were not equipped while we were here. |The WiFi signal is strong throughout the hotel and we could even get a signal in the restaurant next door. The breakfast is a buffet which did not disappoint and prepared us for the day ahead.Nwe Waddy Hotel is very well located and is only a short drive from The Grand Palace and other temples.|Book in absolute confidence that your stay here will be nothing short of bliss. |","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nay Thu R","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeNj0UTN0yIrCGyJ0JhWwDODOg5QjAH0gdfB9Ji-oFl0zWFI-YVmhNAr-FGLycdpIjFmw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Very nice hotel, Located in Mandalay, 10 min Walked from Royal Palace and City Centre, 15 min Walked from Mandalay Hill, KuThoDaw Pagoda as The World Biggest Book.|Good facilities with Commodious Car parking, nice Swimming Pool at Entrance. Splendid Lobby, Capacious Dining Room and Bed Room.|Warmly welcome and friendly staff and nice cleaning.","Images":null,"When":""}]

Though, the wifi was slow, like any other hotel I have ever been to, and the tv signal strength was bad, it is really a good hotel. 10 out of 10 recommended","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kevin G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Clean, terrific rooms, nicest staff you can imagine! The bellman always opens the door for you, the inside bellman always opens the elevator for you with a smile and gets you on your way. You always get answers and help at the front desk from smiling staff. The second-floor dining room has delicious food. The free breakfast is really wonderful - eggs/omelets, beef stroganoff, traditional Asia noodle station, meats, fresh fruits, vegetables and more! Lunch and dinner are really good and convenient if you don't want to go back out into the city. The laundry service is first-rate - your clothes come back individually packaged in cellophane bags, almost like you are buying them for the first time. Flatscreen TVs are smart, so easy to watch whatever you like. So clean! We stayed for almost a week and will come back when we travel to Mandalay again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kamil Pikal","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIU1_1Nj-0TmcURX_Gt-uRBI69tWJ__mDv04NjueW-3n5XkUQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I had a really good time there.
