The staff was really attentive. They were helpful to find me a tourist guide. I like their evening bbq and you get 2 free drinks at the bar everyday which is very appreciated. I recommend this place!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Trip.com Member","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Buffet breakfast is good, BBQ restaurant and beer garden. location is one hour from Mandalay Airport,security guard at entrance and safe place","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Trip.com Member","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Incredibly good hotel for the price, I tried other more expensive ones in Mandalay but this one was way better than any other in terms of room space, cleanliness, general service etc. I even saw and heard other European guests were saying the same that they should have found and chosen this hotel earlier. The breakfast is very good but the dinner at the restaurant should provide wider choices and various sizes of dish, because they are all mega-portion stuff with 10000 kyat or so and I couldn't finish the plate. I would prefer smaller sized dish with lower price for single person and at least they can make it half-size. And I never figured out how to order the BBQ and Hot Pot because nobody in the restaurant space explained about that, nor had I seen any menu book about them although it is exhibitingly cooked open-air. The hotel clerks are kind and polite but I didn't see they were fully orchestrated in  an excellent hotel team manner. Anyway overall the stay was great and this hotel secured my pleasant and fruitful trip to Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Trip.com Member","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The room was big and clean and had a bath tub. The AC kept the room cool in the summer heat. The buffet breakfast was delicious and had a huge and varied choice and the restaurant staff were really helpful and friendly. The swimming pool was nice and refreshing and the gym was a welcome addition, if a little old. Overall, a great place to stay when visiting Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Akbar Khan","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocItRjMf1pEMComRG0CKZop3iZKqzWAQdJlWxI_p2ITe5r4x=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The best cheap luxury new hotel in Mandalay with superb bar restaurant spa etc in a very nice location next to top eateries. The hotel is very new with gym pool and chilled outdoor restaurant as well as indoor . The buffet breakfast is massive and comprehensive looking more like a dinner buffet with chef at noodle and omelette station bakery and cakes is a giant selection as are the curries rices soups and traditional breakfasts and of course fresh coffee and fruit juice.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"alexio","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKsaZ_8NLxrq3vhNSq5xFvwgTBW8HcaxJGqkUQxA-4glEiR9g=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"It's not a modern hotel, but the rooms are clean and the water pressure is good. In addition, the view and sunset of Mandalay city from the room are very beautiful.

I can't say breakfast is good, but the outdoor swimming pool and gym are well maintained. And the nightly garden bbq and various foods create a good atmosphere for a beer.

In short, this hotel is the best cost-effectiveness in Mandalay.

The staff are, of course, very friendly!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Trip.com Member","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I highly recommend this hotel in Mandalay from the very accommodating staff to the cleanest room and their amazing facilities. The breakfast was absolutely delicious with different varieties of food to choose from. The restaurant as well makes delicious and authentic Myanmar food!","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Diamonds Inn
address: No.E, SY Building, 78th Street Between 29th Street x 30th Street , Hay Mar Za Latt Quarter, Chan Aye Thar Zan Township, Mandalay 11101
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No.E, SY Building, 78th Street Between 29th Street x 30th Street , Hay Mar Za Latt Quarter, Chan Aye Thar Zan Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"11101","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Paingthu Htet","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV6JVFUwjxhd5L3jp41dWukiTCC1dMEBylbB7HGR4ei6ydYfDVK=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"WiFi connection is really slow. I want to show the speed test but it doesn‚Äôt even load to speed test page. There‚Äôs a TV in the room but it doesn‚Äôt work. The stuff are not that welcoming may be welcome to foreigners but with the local, they are not that nice. The room is fine but it doesn‚Äôt worth the money.
The neighborhood is surrounded by hotels and they run their generators all night long and you can hear it. Room is not that soundproof.
For nearly 50K for the price and no breakfast is what me disappoint.
I have traveled a lot with business and I have been to a lot of hotels, this Diamond Inn is the worst place to rest.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Felix Z","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcoKrjftg2H5FSPDgamEji1HcAj6KJIMYEaB28IfM5URISpFokTGJ4TKCMmdB7Et-p_0g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After checking in we had to change rooms immediately because they had given us two single beds and unfortunately the previous guest had smoked in the room. We then had a room inside the hotel with no windows so it was always a bit damp until we turned on the AC. Towels and bedding was dirty so we asked for exchanging them which was no problem and quickly done. Since other travellers picked up on the same issue it might be worth changing some of their towels/bedding. Very friendly staff at reception and breakfast. Considering the price we were happy with the breakfast. We also tried the free bikes which is quite an experience in Mandalay. If you are looking for a simple place to stay for 1-2 nights then we can recommend this place!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Denisa Rekic","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWczN06mLtXWky8JER4Nf542uPAaMwdzqgVkxgILMTjj1KRL6aOew=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The staff at Diamonds Inn is superb!  There is one guy, who has the most amazing smile, that went above and beyond to be welcoming and helpful.  We would like to thank them for taking good care of us.  They were helpful in arranging all the transportation we needed, providing insight about things to do/around the area.

The room was very clean, spacious, and the shower was great!  The only thing to keep in mind is the street noise of traffic (if you‚Äôre a light sleeper).

The breakfast was served buffet style, and it was very good.  The location was great ‚Äì not in the very ‚Äúcentral‚Äù area, but about 15-30 min walk to there.

Would highly recommend a stay here!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"matthias200587","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV4MFlwoC6jEvFeNNlco2zNKsaoFvg3zyNthtmZWfiPS61LB0rz=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Good:
- The staff was very friendly and accomodating.
- Good breakfast (and they do take-out box if you need to leave earlier).
- Room was great (the one not facing the street), and we could get some much needed rest.
- They arrange taxi from/to airport at a suitable price. We would come back again!

Not so good:
- Well, if you actually intend to sleep, state clearly ahead of coming that you need a quiet room. We had a room facing the main street on our first night and although very tired I don't think we slept 2h in the whole night... It felt like the cars were driving through the room, and those windows did not stop any noise...
- The exchange rate if you want to pay with the local currency is, as usual in Myanmar, not good.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"MORG8989NYC","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Great 1 night stay. Helpful recommending food + activities. Strong shower. Flexible checkout. Room had no windows but we used the room to simply sleep + you want to wake up early to see the sunrise at the bridge. ||The operations manager was excellent - very kind, great English and on top of the hotel. ||Recommend.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"geology123","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qexe1uajF-TSqvbHLzgtUk80BSJEirwlZxdhwIhHVVewMbFHRaNf97WJ3b7Rq47i8M9nA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The staff are what makes this hotel, as they are extremely friendly and helpful. We are vegetarians and they made is special breakfast dishes that were delicious. They also wrote a note for us in Burmese to use in town that explained we don't eat meat. Most rooms don't have windows, which would have been nice, but otherwise were very comfortable. As my son, who has traveled a lot in Asia said: "I was amazed that every item in the room worked!"","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Priscilla W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. However, the wifi in our room (on the second level) did not work at all and the room smelt a bit funny (like sewerage, but I guess that might just be a thing in Myanmar plumbing). The staff offered to let us change to a different room where the wifi would be working (as they couldn't get it working) but we had already unpacked and was only staying one night so we kindly declined their offer. Other than that, the room was fine and the breakfast was also decent (mostly Myanmar style breakfast). Location of the hotel is also great if you're arriving by train. Restaurants are at a walkable distance or a short tuk tuk ride away.||||The hotel organised a driver for us to visit selected sights in Mandalay and to drive us to Bagan the following day. We paid quite a bit for the service ($160 USD) and they said it was going to be an English speaking driver. However, there was something dodgy going on with the driver (not the hotel's fault). The English speaking driver that was booked picked us up from the hotel, then drove for 2 minutes and told us that he's sick and his brother will be driving us for the day. His brother was very nice, but barely spoke a word of English so we were really confused when he dropped us off at the attractions (he didn't give us any information at all). We had no idea whether we needed to buy tickets and if so, where to buy the tickets. He had to phone his brother several times, basically every time we asked a question or if he wanted to ask us a question. I'm not sure why his brother didn't just pick us up from the hotel in the first place (perhaps he was trying to do a sneaky and didn't want the hotel to know that he offloaded a job to someone else?). We set off to Bagan at around 4pm, so I think the driver was in a bit of a rush to drop us off so he can return to Mandalay at a reasonable time. He drove extremely fast (the car didn't have any seatbeats so we were a bit concerned) and even hit a dog and killed it :( (he apologised for hitting the dog when we arrived at Bagan)","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Max G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed there for two nights in two different rooms because we made a mistake when booking. The staff was fantastic, doing everything they could. However, the hotel is starting to get old and the building has its limitations such as|- no windows in many rooms and the breakfast room|- very loud, since doors let through most noise from outside the room|- uncomfortable neon light in rooms|- smelly drains|- dirty joins etc in shower||Certainly impeccable value for money at 22 USD, however do not understand why this hotel ranks so high overall in Myanmar, even for non price sensitive sorting. ||Still, thank you very much for the stay!","Images":null,"When":""}]

[{"Name":"Jose Rehbein","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVG3FNRWLl8BXLtg9jublnHk6FWKBrg5hlZBdsZDNsKa57gXmM_=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great service, they allowed us to do early check in even though we arrived at 7 AM, that was great. They provide a decent breakfast, can sort out tours and transfers, and staff is always happy to help out ( though most of them know little English). Free water in the room, clean and roomy. They were flexible and packed our breakfast as we had to leave early on our checkout.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"aka FreshPfarrer","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJ2rOigzSYGKZPiPNKQw-H4ZeaEorP1NfPzXFBlsi60JE9SlA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"It's a really good hotel and so cheap. The staff is amazing. They are more kind and helpful than in most 5* hotels in Europe. You can also organize bustickets and other things from them. The only thing I would suggest you not to do is the restaurant. You can find much better food next to the hotel on the street kitchens. But for drink and the great view from the rooftop it is worth it!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Joseph Wheater","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWWePseH-oxue4WLAINiQLYl2Z0WKa34QG-XIrU2_RtyZJljlTH=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"We were first shown to a room which smelt heavily of smoke. Then when we requested a different room, we were downgraded with no compensation or apology. The new room was infested with cockroaches in the bathroom and bedroom which we complained about, only to be told that they don‚Äôt ‚Äòaccept‚Äô the problem. When we asked to speak to the manager they told us that he was in Yangon and didn‚Äôt speak English (both lies) and that we could pay $2 and leave. We paid immediately only to be told that we had to pay the full amount. They stood by the door and refused to let us leave. We then spoke to the manager who treated us just as badly as his staff. The staff told us we were lying and were openly mocking us.

I cannot recommend you to NOT stay here strongly enough.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"James H","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel is hands down one of the friendliest hotels I have ever been to. I booked twice on my travels around Myanmar because I was so impressed that I had to stay again before my flight out. I do not give rankings of 5 because I try to make them worth it (I've only ever given two, including this hotel.) If you're going to be in Mandalay, and you're looking for a budget hotel, this is the one you need to go to.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"beizebopp","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJIcSmzCqaGbSDOXkMDqvhMm05DC5P34sa39hTqeqJgVhvO4w=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"The room was comfortable and clean and the front of house staff were very attentive.
The receptionist booked our bus transfer to Yangon and called a taxi for us. Their card machine was not working so he accompanied me to the bus station and we stopped at an atm on the way.
Unfortunately the premises on the corner played loud music/chanting/speeches until late into the night, which was loud enough in our room to be an irritation while trying to get to sleep.
The restaurant in the top floor was overpriced and we had orders missed and mixed up when only 2 small groups were dining.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Hans G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdcKHisBXAOJmIugCgnKbcAscQkQI1t40WdQAMXk1g3ttzWj18FtKnHxNeSUm5OfHPMtQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"All very positive for this hotel, super friendly and helpful staff. Helped us with organizing tours which were good value for money. WiFi could be better and breakfast buffet didn‚Äôt offer much choice. But for the price we paid definitely a good choice","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"HTET MYAT HTOO","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXPFOKO9MWoU7hRPrQJEsXsT5VSrGGNl6KkJHuXrN1BY6lS2CGgYw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Price is very reasonable and staffs also friendly. Most of hotel in mdy charges upon local and foreigner rates. This hotel charged with whoever come with local or foreigners doesn‚Äôt matter. They will charged same rates. Room are quite clean and good to stay within your budget. Breakfast don‚Äôt enough to choose many things.Only they have Toast and Rice with bean and potato curry with free tea/coffee as usual budget hotel.Car parking only provided for one spot which always reserved with hotel owner‚Äôs vehicle :-p.
Hotel location is little bit far from mdy downtown( railways station and 78street) but easy to access go outside with 3 wheels or motorbike.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipN0ss7ObPE93Y-3skyFvpLtzEvfp8_177x_PHSc&fid=0x0:0xc3284a1ddd0fcf03"],"When":"2019-8-20"},{"Name":"Kyle Howard","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXGArIu2wpyg2OOHU6vOlbyCNzNG32mBf1jlwWcKatSKAXWv_eWnw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Pros:
- Breakfast was a very good selection, lots of food available, and they are willing to help our accommodating a vegetarian/vegan diet.
- Skybar with live music and you get one free drink
- Some staff (the younger guys) are extremely kind and helpful. They rented us a motorbike, carried our bags up to our room, and the biggest thing was when booking a bus to Kalaw. We ended up changing our minds for a different option after booking with them, and they were able to change it for us and arrange the new one.
- New and clean everything

Cons:
- Away from things so you will need a taxi or to rent a motorbike to get around.
- Bathroom had nasty smell that spread into the rest of the room.
- The older lady behind the counter was rude and tried to charge us more for the same services that the young guy sold us. She also gave us bad information that was wrong. We felt like she was always trying to rip us off.
- There were many ants crawling over us during the nightime
- Loud A/C
- Construction next to our room was quite noisy during day and early evening
- Live music at night on roof can be heard in our room on the 1st floor
- Restaurant is terrible, completely avoid it except for breakfast. All of the dishes in our dinner were cold, not even slightly warm. The portion size of the lentil soup is ridiculously small. Some dishes come extremely spicy with no warning, like grilled potatoes, which aren't even grilled, they're boiled.
- Tint on the windows is very dark, making the room quite dim unless you turn all the lights on.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Gold Leaf Hotel
address: 36th Street, Between 77th &, 78th St, Mandalay 11101
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Min Kyaw Wai","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXqe-oYm5OQu3oYChrjui2_JqPNmHSpvg7v-s4agC7WGUzwpXty=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Good hotel amongst the local hotels available in Mandalay. Rooms are quite good. Breakfast is not so good due to variety and taste. Due to renovation, there were a few breakdown including internet. No proper car parking available also. Hope this place will become better after renovation is done.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipMJITuoAh6qD-ZMxpHbo5_lx5_sNJU3RszpuBg8&fid=0x0:0xaacc39d30e412579"],"When":"2022-11-12"},{"Name":"Mark Bernamoff","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLTyougz7z1jKZmEa1-7Y5vGml03-m0rPusuWDMnJS_Cdo7iw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Stayed 4 nights recently in 2 rooms for our family of 4. Check-in staff could not be nicer, even surprised us within the first hour with a birthday cake complete with candles & eating utensils! Clean, comfortable rooms & lovely hotel in general. Breakfast buffet was plentiful with a good variety & staff was over the top to help us with stronger & fresh coffee/tea which was much appreciated. In particular the lady manager (War War Wint?) was fantastic. Overall highly recommended!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Rodney Egel","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLksqe96Out7BfD2P84UFTLmAfndRdRzgIfWVHylLIRsWMtwg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Everything is still new-looking, clean, and fancy - from the lobby to the rooms and the rooftop dining and bar area.  The staff are always smiling and helpful too.  Mandalay isn't really a walkable city, so the fact that this hotel isn't within walking distance of tourist sites can be forgiven.  There are some shopping areas nearby, and a few restaurants if you aren't that choosy.  This place is a great value for your money.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipOrTiLyRMdIlfWdWZLQzTQHf8wvVeky73z_8yOX&fid=0x0:0xaacc39d30e412579"],"When":"2020-1-2"},{"Name":"Nihad Khan","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKIdGHlSrw9Att5SpgqSjOIHxk-RYFkS0AnU34milkXN71S4g=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Our room was clean and comfortable, and had a great view of the sunrise. The manager and staff were very friendly and accommodating as they helped us with some issues we were experiencing booking bus tickets. Location is also great as it is close to tourist sites as well as some great restaurants.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Michael Lee","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJ3bwzDu6LfjhUhn3nlG_YC6tn0RDrAaeR7_uGbV-g1C5GElgA_=s120-c-rp-mo-ba7-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Price was okay, service from staff were excellent, very friendly and attentive staff. Restaurant situated on 11th floor with buffet style breakfast. The restaurant had great view of Mandalay city area. The room was how ever moderate, decorating finish within the bothroom was poor and a little dirty in some area. Overall the stay was okay but the room could be better.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNQvTXwTiooZHv4a2aK5ia5NUAoOtLTualVJbVT&fid=0x0:0xaacc39d30e412579"],"When":"2019-2-10"},{"Name":"Joseph","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLlM306svcJMIzOOK12P4RsUkZDWVagiSIacGg13jr2hTuvnw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Pros:
- Central location, fairly easy to spot from afar for when you're taking a taxi or scooter
- Clean surroundings (room, lobby, corridor carpet etc)
- powerful hot water in the bathroom
- Nice rooftop bar with delicious Mandalay rum sour
- Decent sized room with a safe, and key card access (also needed for lift access)
- cool little touches like dimmable lights next to your bed
- Reasonably priced
- Aircon in the room seems to be on when you come back in the evening, so you return to a cool room
- Service staff try their best to please. They happily obliged with more bottles of water each day, and always held the lift where possible
- Delicious Mandalay rum sours for 2500K at their rooftop bar, which has a nice view at the 11th floor of the surrounding town

Cons:
- Some parts of the room appear unfinished (e.g. piping points not covered, wood paneling exposed etc)
- Staff speak just a little English
- WiFi was a bit spotty initially, but the staff resolved this by sending down their IT guy
- The kettle wasn't working, but I borrowed one in an adjacent vacant room
- We were initially offered a room whose window literally faced a wall. Luckily they offered us one that actually faced town! It appears there is construction right next to this building, and possibly all rooms on the left of the hotel would have views fully obscured?
- only one lift works of the two, sometimes you've to wait a short while for the lift to arrive","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNwerJQ7rr2czg7WO36UUiE4WSrXMcXPUBg4Dgj&fid=0x0:0xaacc39d30e412579"],"When":"2022-10-25"},{"Name":"Pauline Wong","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWXehiAGFn55JUCaKJOTgAoG_R4qfO0OJ0oGBeLCeA6Q3NrZEg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Room is clean and comfortable. All staff in hotel are helpful, nice and polite from reception to restaurant.  Nice breakfast.  Only distruptive is the frequent power failure, probably due to dry season.  Thank you to all the staff.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"RADIANT RAVIKANT","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVYPYKpP6deEhnBetA2ounM9nGehK82K1El2usZqGRAII8FR3b8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Rooms are good if they are with Open window...Best part is their Roof Top Restaurant where you can admire half of the city from the 11th Floor along with Delicious food.","Images":null,"When":""}]

Staffs were so pleasant. We will most definitely stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Tuntun U","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed there only one night on March 29. My room 110 on the first floor was quite enough space for budget hotel but found betel spit on the wall caused by previous guests was too ugly(see my picture).Also found suspicious spitting on the wall (see my picture)caused by previous couple guests as well. Drainage system in washroom and washing basin were very slow due to blocked with hair. That‚Äôs why hotel management and housekeeping staff need attention and take care with drain cleaning powder. Other main problem there was slow WiFi. It‚Äôs immediately requirement tusk for all local and foreigners guests. Breakfast there was better than other 4 stars hotels from Mandalay. title: Hotel My World
address: No. 70, 30th St, Bet 73rd x 74th St, Chan Aye Thar San, Mandalay 11332
descriptions: Simple rooms in a low-key city centre budget hotel offering a restaurant, free Wi-Fi & bike rentals.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No. 70, 30th St, Bet 73rd x 74th St, Chan Aye Thar San","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"11332","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"articfired","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdrOaBwvzVCVZGa_JCxmRob18-RTGR2NAc2ehM2ioIFQuUJBtaO6jr7GHqX15LV00VYsw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We were in town for medical reasons and booked this hotel as it was only a couple blocks from the hospital.  We found the staff to be most helpful in all we needed and even walked us to the hospital after dark!  The rooms were small, but very clean.  TV and WiFi available. Room are air conditioned. Snacks and drinks were available in the room for purchase.  Large breakfast buffet on the weekend.||Typical Myanmar breakfast, but we were able to order eggs. ||Close to several tourist attractions and restaurants.||Would definately stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"sol653","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeSe9ibNVY65MpgeQh70I370foM0-7tEPyVc9CIfSq5Ekli093sZJVPBoLD5d5qPK_2rw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The hotel location is great for sightseeing. The rooms are clean if not a little small, but they have everything from fast internet, big TV and a good bathroom with shower. The breakfast served on the top floor restauant was good and it was very nice to sit outside in the evenings with a drink.  The best at this hotel was the staff: Very polite, helpful with anything and allways smiling.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Soe Htut A","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"During my previous business trips, I used to stay at a well known hotel with a higher price tag. But this time, it happened to choose this one. Honestly, I was not impressed with it's apartment style front view. But, when stepped into the lobby I met with friendly staffs performing decently. The rooms, they seem small if you plan to stay all day long. But if you plan to have a tour during day times, the new decoration, cozy beds, new and shinny showers, and big LCD TV will serve you the best. Only one draw back is its lack of compound and building is close to neighbors. So, please expect some noises from the neighbors in the afternoon. I would suggest to choose the higher floor. Staffs are new and need more experiences, but they are friendly and learning type. Finally, the location is in the middle of everywhere...I mean, you need to walk but you could explore many within walking distance.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kate M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My partner and I stayed here as part of our backpacking trip around SEAsia, and so enjoyed the experience.  The room was small (but everything in Myanmar is) but clean and the space was well-used.  The bathroom was immaculate with a fantastic shower.  The staff was extremely friendly and helped us with anything we needed from sight seeing information to booking cabs or tickets.  I would definitely stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jenny N","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Among the 5 hotels I stayed in Myanmar, this was the best hotel!  The room was clean and great shower !!  The service was excellent,  staff was very friendly, courteous and alert. ||||There's a coffee shop just a few lots away for hotel, tried the Mohinga, a kind of noodles with fish soup,   I really enjoyed it together with locals and it only costs 600kyts. per bowl.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Dktari","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Room was a bit small, but bath and shower great, air conditioning excellent and welcome, free wifi, good breakfast with eggs, fruit, and breads. The rooftop bar is a great place for a cold drink at sunset! Staff were helpful and cheerful. Located directly across from medical school.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Liat L","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel is very nice: new facilities, everything works great. ||I booked the suite but was disappointed to notice it has 2 beds (double+single) - so it doesn't feel very luxurious or romantic, more like a small family room :) The double rooms are also very small, but nice.||Breakfast was good but most of the selection was gone toward the end; if you want the full choice, don't wait for the last 1/2 hour of breakfast time.||The staff was extremely friendly and made every effort to keep us happy.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Hnin Wai L","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdcKHisBXAOJmIugCgnKbcAscQkQI1t40WdQAMXk1g3ttzWj18FtKnHxNeSUm5OfHPMtQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Hotel staff are friendly, responsive and willing to help. Hotel is nicely decorated but in lobby, there are plenty of mosquitos. You may need mosquito repellent if you would like to sit at hotel sky bar or lobby. Rooms are not very spacious and the front row rooms that faced to the west are hot in evening because of afternoon heat. Hotel provides breakfast including Myanmar traditional food, Chinese food, bread and fruits. The front row rooms are also noisy at night because of pigeons. Hotel is near to moat, only 10 minutes walking distance.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Grand Park Hotel

We stayed in the executive family room on the 27th floor with a beautiful view. The room is large and clean. The bathroom is spacious with a rain shower and bathtub. The water pressure is good and warm. They also have a rooftop bar on and swimming pool. The food at the rooftop bar is nice. The service is good as well. Overall, the hotel is nice and worth the money. But  ... the tv channels are not so played well and automatically stopped after a few minutes. The light sockets are cheaply installed and some of them are loose. This should be reviewed and fixed for a five stars standard. Easily accessible to anywhere and the tuk tuk taxi are available just outside the hotel. But since it is situating on the busy road, if you prefer tranquility, the hotel is not advisable.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"RealKaren33","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Very clean rooms. We took the family room and it was perfect for our family of 4-very spacious, nice soft pillows. The pool was amazing-located on the rooftop, it allowed us to have a great view of the amazing blue skies of Mandalay. It was clean and well maintained. Breakfast was good-with fruits, omelettes available, local Cuisine-would have loved some pastry-just a bit of sweet. If you are looking for great service this is the place for you. The service was INCREDIBLE. The staff was amazing-all staff ensured that we were comfortable and felt catered to-from the bellman, to the office staff, the General Manager, the restaurant staff‚Ä¶everyone went out of their way to make our stay in Mandalay very special. We would recommend it to families and singles looking for a comfortable place to stay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Hkun Seng","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU0saROlKE2ONicn-1khsXT55kxPG0RuXETfHqyRuK4SmLvCown=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Worst customer service hotel in all of Myanmar. I parked my car underground, gave the bellboy my shoe bag. The elevator from the underground parking is closed so have to walk up the drive way to the lobby. The shoe bag did not make it to my room. I asked to see the duty manager but they said he went out. Asked them to check the CCTV and the person in charge of the CCTV room said why did you lose it! Smelt alcohol on his breath during working hours. They said they cannot log into their CCTV because of password error. I don't think they have ever opened it before or know how to use it. Did not get back my shoe, no responsibility from hotel at all. All staff treats you rudely instead of providing HOSPITALITY! Clearly they do not know that they work in the HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jeff D","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The check-in was quick as no one else there. The staff were friendly. They took our passports and we had to ask for them back later that day. They didn't seem to know they had them and found them on the reception desk. The room was large with great views of the city. The hotel has been newly purchased, and though it was luxurious, it needs updating in small areas. The breakfast food was good but there were too many staff to guests ratio in the large dining room you felt a bit uneasy. The location isnt quite the city centre. We were unsure we had pre-paid or not and they didn't ask us on check-in so we thought we would pay on check-out like some other hotels. However they rung us at 10pm the night before and asked us to come to reception and settle the bill. We explained that we were in bed ready to go to the sleep, so they asked to come up, which they. They also only wanted cash, so we had scramble around  for that. Inexperience? Could be a really good hotel.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Zarni Koko","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUSkT0WkYtZeS719x6WbEnDocUAeq7IgFlZu39d7_T2GAGQ_9k=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Very bad customer service and low altitude staffs","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Mandalay Swan Hotel
address: No. 44(B) 26th , Bet 66th & 68th Street, Chan Aye Thar San Tsp, Mandalay
descriptions: Unfussy rooms in a casual hotel offering 2 hectares of gardens, 4 dining options & an outdoor pool.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No. 44(B) 26th , Bet 66th \u0026 68th Street, Chan Aye Thar San Tsp","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Noraiza A","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeNj0UTN0yIrCGyJ0JhWwDODOg5QjAH0gdfB9Ji-oFl0zWFI-YVmhNAr-FGLycdpIjFmw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed at this hotel recently for business purposes. Had an event that I was involved in which was also held at the hotel so it was convenient. ||||First impression - this hotel look dated. Like i stepped into a hotel back in the early 90s. The furniture, decor and overall atmosphere looks like it has seen better days. But, I have to say that the hotel is clean and the staff members are very friendly, polite and helpful. Some may not understand English well but they try their best to accommodate.||||The room that I got was huge - a junior suite - that could easily fit 3-4 persons comfortably. It was located on the ground floor right at the end of this long corridor which, thankfully, was facing the main road (or it would have been really secluded and quiet...too quiet). Room was clean but it had an \"old room\" smell, not musty, just....old. It was neat and tidy, the bathroom was sparkling clean and also huge, located in the middle of the suite. The room was not well lit though, there were many light fixtures but the lights still seemed dim, the room still felt rather dark and there were many shadowed areas. There was only one main switch for the whole room other than the toilet lights and a small bedside light facing the floor. There were mosquitoes in the room (likely because it's so dark and there're a lot of plants nearby) but it wasn't so bad. ||||I didn't try going into the swimming pool but it looked inviting enough. ||||The breakfast was simple. Very basic. But at least they make fresh fruit juices with real fruits, not the boxed up fruit concentrate usually served at bigger and newer hotels. ||||Overall, it's a hotel to go to if you are on a tight budget (or in my case, because some other party arranged my accommodations).","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"MIB Tour Compan... M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel is located at the front of Royal Palace Moat. At the corner, they have owned small restaurant called Kipling. They have no elevators.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Howard S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdcKHisBXAOJmIugCgnKbcAscQkQI1t40WdQAMXk1g3ttzWj18FtKnHxNeSUm5OfHPMtQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This a place in need of a major infusion of funds. The beakfast mediocre. The weight room is sad. On the hand, its Myanmar so the undetpaid staff is friendly, helpful attentive. The morning wait staff are great. Housekeeping wonderful. (you can go to the nearest restaurant to have breakfast, you can go to GENERATION just across the road or Shwe Pyi Moe just around the corner of  Hilton which is just beside of this Hotel.||5. title: Hotel Capital
address: No.133 Corner of 84th and, ·Äú·Äô·Ä∫·Ä∏ ·ÅÉ·ÅÄ, Mandalay 11011
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Emma P","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcHdm0oAuHtzPwzcwUtTqUfPbZXmYnyyN78cO7_Z2aHVLpBkIuu0olTbSpOuQZcPV9sYQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This felt like a fantastic find as most other places we had looked within our price range had extremely variable reviews. The staff here are super friendly and we were greeted with a welcome drink and a very smooth check-in. Our room was on the 6th floor and it was spacious and spotless. Despite being in the middle of a bustling city, we were not bothered at all by noise. The air-con worked beautifully and the bed was large and comfortable. The wifi was reliable and fast.||||The bathroom was a large wet room which wasn't an issue at all - the floor dried rapidly and there were no lingering smells. There was plenty of hot water. We ordered room service for dinner as we arrived quite late and were knackered. Having almost exclusively eaten local food for the preceding weeks, I ordered the pasta aglio e olio which, to my surprise, was absolutely delicious. We didn't try the spa but the prices looked extremely reasonable.||||Breakfast had plenty of choice (both european and local) and we particularly enjoyed eating outside (although you could also sit indoors) at the rooftop restaurant with all the buildings glowing in the morning sunrise and the bustle of streets below.||||There are plenty of places within walking distance of the hotel and it was super easy to get a Grab tuktuk or taxi. The hotel was also very generous with the complementary water and we didn't end up needing to purchase any ourselves.||||Overall, my expectations were very much exceeded by this wonderful hotel - I would highly recommend it as a palce to stay in Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"laurandjan","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc1kNGO8LfCIUkNiXrsfeYG3onj8HWsGiBwC71th43hKBnE5GlvQyCYmZ1-b-eE7ReWRw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We had a wonderful experience at this hotel! We loved the food here and the red wine was amazing! The staff was really kind and they also provide a massage service, which was very good! Breakfast is delicious. There are son many different things to choose between: traditional dishes, bread, eggs, greens, fresh fruits \u0026 much more!||Next time we come back at this hotel!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ashley Burns","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXUd5qNjgM3_HGrI5TgtUZzTxpdQzb-UgrSO4ePwWRlbZ9kC6N7=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The spa on the 7th floor is AmAZing!!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"sarah b","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeSe9ibNVY65MpgeQh70I370foM0-7tEPyVc9CIfSq5Ekli093sZJVPBoLD5d5qPK_2rw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I booked a room in May for 25$. Asked my local friend to call and make sure that they accept Visa cards. She was told that they do so we came and stayed there one night. Tried to pay for the room 4 times: when we arrived, after checking in,  the next day before breakfast and one more time after breakfast. Every time it was something related to their machine. OK. My friend spoke to the manager or owner and we agreed that we‚Äôll come back in two weeks when their machine is working properly. |In June they call us to say that it‚Äôs finally working properly. We were travelling so we came to the hotel as soon as we were back in Mandalay. What do you think? |They made us wait around 40 minutes playing with my visa and the machine and unable to get their payment because they were NOT TRAINED to do it!!! And instead of recognising it and calling the bank right away, they called a hotel employee who was manipulating it endlessly without any result. I started losing my patience because we had things to do and so we told them that we‚Äôll come back another day when there‚Äôs somebody qualified to proceed to the payment. |They gave me back my card then chased us again outside to take it back and try again! |Waiting again for him to finally realise that he should call the bank. title: Hotel Marvel

We loved the bed and pillow very much because of its comfort. There was some smell in the drainage tube in the bathroom. The reception ladies were nice and helpful. We had dinner in the hotel which was good and price reasonable. The breakfast had many selections. We will come back.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sherine C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Room is spacious, clean and managed to have a decent hot shower. |Our room was one level 6 and we had trouble getting a good sleep. level 7 was a ktv studio and our window was facing the train station. |Service however was good and so was the dried shan noodles at breakfast bar.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sharyn G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Air conditioning didnt work in our first room so we were relocated. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast provided a good range of selections and a coffee machine. 5th floor at front of building was quite noisy from train station but our second room on 6th floor was much quieter.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"KK","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXaIJaxBbdFGixyXcQZh4KP4ph0hFL5RzKzCZXzSzIWyXpUwU6D=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"A property that is conveniently located above the Mandalay Train station. Perfect for travelers catching the train connection. Though a bit aged, the rooms were very well maintained and I had a good rest before preparing for my onward journey to Yangon. The buffet breakfast in the hotel with local delicacies was really extensive and tasty too! Would recommend it to travelers looking for a place to put up as it is very centrally located to a wide variety of retail and F\u0026B offerings!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Dan C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I liked it from the first time. At top of Mandalay Central station you suppose to be living in noise area. Not at all. Nice view, windy and lovely view over Mandalay hill. ||Lovely staff, working hard to make my needs fullfill. ||Nice room, the tv reception can be better. But I like the hotell and will easily recommend it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jay K","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews.  Curiously, half the reviews said it was quiet and half found the train horn noise too much.  It is situated on top of the main rail terminal.  My view is in between these extremes.  We were here three nights.  I am a very light sleeper.  My girlfriend could sleep through WWIII.  The first night, I heard the train horn blow 7 times.  Not a good sleep at all.  The next two nights, I slept 7.5 and 8 hours and didn't wake up once!  I did not use ear plugs, although I had them.  She slept soundly every night.||||||That's the only bad news.  I must admit, that when I entered my room the first time, I was sad to see such cheap furniture.  Also, there was a staleness to the air, but it was not really noticeable the remaining three days.  We had a large room.  The shower is basically just a curtain pulled over a section of the bathroom.  There is a small bar on the floor, but it only works 75% at keeping the water in the shower area.  We just put down a towel on the floor and that solved the problem.  The highlight of the bathroom is that this is one of the best shampoos I ever used.  In my 200+ trips overseas, only once before did I have \"squeaky clean\" hair! Air conditioning and internet were excellent.||||||The breakfast was very good.  My girfriend is Asian and she lover that food.  I ate Western and it was satisfying.  Usually the bacon was well done which I like.  Once it was almost raw and they happily re-cooked it until I was satisfied.  The bread pudding is very dry, but 5 feet away was a gravy boat with sweetened condensed milk.  I poured it on the putting and let it sit.  Then, the pudding was great!  There is a very nice variety and they change about 35% of it daily  The capucino was excellent!  The black tea (Lipton) must have been a very high grade - not the normal terrible kind because it, too, was excellent.||||We ate dinner here one night because ROASTED PEKING DUCK for 3-5 people was only US $10.00!!!!  I later found out that roasted is not the same as traditional Peking Duck.  There were no pancakes, but they made crepes for us!  Also, quite cute, there was no hoisin sauce - rather we had American barbeque sauce!  What a hoot!  WELCOME TO MYANMAR!!!!||||The hotel is about 8 blocks from the night market, which is very small and does not open when they expect rain.  Tuk-tuks are everywhere and very cheap.  Taxis are hard to find and cost double of the tuk-tuks.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Wilson Hotel

descriptions: Colorful rooms in a relaxed hotel offering a spa, a restaurant & a rooftop deck with a pool.
complete_address: {"borough":"Mahaaungmyay","street":"No.31 (E), 78th Street (Yangon-Mandalay Main Road Maha Aung Myay Township, ·Åá·Åà ·Äú·Äô·Ä∫·Ä∏","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"05032","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"jamielq","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_m0BOt0e288CC5xVhlFJeGbeLoq1HoB7h5IAKHAwOrWyFaFWxIwsJ8EDSK3zkB1-qng=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Wilson is tired. My 7th floor room was large with somewhat of a view although windows filthy. Bed firm, fridge turns off when you leave. Have to switch on hot water manually. Bathroom very dated. AC works ok. Pool is ok with a view. Gym is outside in the heat- not so good. Staff friendly but not much English. Breakfast is 2 star for foreigners. Eggs but no beacon. Would be 4 star for locals. Cereal is corn flakes, rice bubbles n coco pops are all mixed together- not good. Sour dough makes good toast. Pineapple n strawberry jam. Cordial disguised as orange juice. |WiFi is hopeless. Have to use a password continuously to get access annoying, speed average. No atmosphere in this hotel. Would stay somewhere else next time","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kelvin C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My group of 8 booked into 4 twin rooms for 2 night here. As we arrived quite late in the evening and there were no restaurant nearby the hotel we decided to take out dinner at there roof top restaurant. A big hall where breakfast is served too. There were no other guest there but our dinner took more than an hour just for simple fried rice and noddles. Buffet breakfast food was ok and you can see the sunrise from here. Rooms are large and decent. Quite a large hotel but seem rather rundown now. Location wise not ideal as there is nothing much around this area.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"icolona","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfndCAq-uxCGOZMI7LGh3BMpWGEbPhcwmoTu71Rum6FWmIVCdty-rocNNYz1q8SL9qX-Q=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After reading the reviews on this hotel I was quite hesitant on staying at this hotel. However, Agoda's reviews gave this hotel a much higher rating so we decided to try it out.||I've stayed in many cheap hotels throughout Asia. This hotel exceeded my expectations for a hotel in Myanmar. ||5 stars: the breakfast had a huge selection and the restaurant had a beautiful view that overlooked the city. ||4 stars: they had a pretty big gym located outside with one treadmill. In the morning it was quiet, and cool outside. The pool looked pretty clean but it was too cold outside to try it out. ||4 stars: I loved our room. It was simple but very spacious and CLEAN. I'm not sure what the other travelers were complaining about. We did have an issue with our children's air con. It wasn't working and they had to move to a different room. The internet was normal for Myanmar. Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't. The water was only lukewarm. I wish it got a little hotter. ||5 stars: the staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us a new room without any hassle. ||The only reason I gave the hotel a four star is because of the air con problems and the lukewarm water. Other than that, we will defiantly be staying here again. Thanks, Wilson Hotel for exceeding my expectations and providing my family with a pleasant stay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"trin 17","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUfDovuEAdggZ7D9o1mFGwQBTeHiy4AK0MfNRjA16yjxtUU3kPq=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Location is convenient. Old school hotel with big rooms and big beds. The wardrobe has no doors mainly so you dont forget things when checking out. Window sound insulation not fantastic and traffic noise quite audible; will be an issue for light sleepers but okay for me. Wifi is quite decent and with flat screen tv. Water heater needs to be switched on in advance.
Daily breakfast is buffet style and choice of dishes are not too bad. View from the restaurant very nice. Small rooftop pool and gym beside it but both are uncovered.
Cafe staff, bellboy and housekeeping staff are quite helpful but there are some language difficulties.
Decent place for forty dollars.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipPMLUggtYo0tTvERpDc_O9cRYscAmcCTSA1DzY2&fid=0x0:0x90ca53b89b4f1d28"],"When":"2019-10-10"},{"Name":"Francis L","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcoKrjftg2H5FSPDgamEji1HcAj6KJIMYEaB28IfM5URISpFokTGJ4TKCMmdB7Et-p_0g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel is one level up from backpacking. The quality of the rooms, especially the bathroom where they provide multiple pairs of flip flops to keep your feet dry, is poor. Water is tepid at best and wifi very unreliable (they use a hotspot that is rarely hot). Many of the young staff are kind and enthusiastic, but look like they should be at school. The hotel relies on these youngsters utterly because they speak some English. Most of the adults don't speak English at all. On one occasion, in the evening, there was nobody on duty who could even understand English well enough to order a taxi. As most of the guests didn't speak Burmese or Chinese and the hotel is a long way out of town, this presented some problems. Astonishingly, this hotel is not cheap for the region. You can do better at half the price.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"LoftusroadW12","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This isn't anything special; so neither get your hopes or expectations up.||The room was clean, but aircon had to be attended to, and it was. The bathroom is a splash room, so that creates all sorts of issues for wet feet and, of course, those with mobility concerns might want to factor that in.||There is a very small pool, which looked clean, and an outdoor gym. The breakfast was ok, although the coffee was dire. Nice view out the window of the restaurant. ||Staff friendly but there is nothing in terms of a decent restaurant in the vicinity. The staff directed us to a hovel of a place, so you'll need to have a venue in mind and use a cab.||Ok for a one night stop over.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"wilbeth","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qcx7DtSIuJI9UJU1ybYoEA6i_uOe_F9V6dOnYVPO8gBdo0k23EJlyGd0YO4_LmJhQZKEQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Room is quite big, comfortable and clean. Downside is the bathroom, you have to turn off the main switch of the heater before you leave your room. It has a swimming pool on the 7th floor and a gym which is nice to spend your free time. The staff are accommodating and friendly.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nigel M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeNj0UTN0yIrCGyJ0JhWwDODOg5QjAH0gdfB9Ji-oFl0zWFI-YVmhNAr-FGLycdpIjFmw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After nearly a week I was glad to leave. The basics were OK, we slept well enough, breakfast was OK and the wifi worked.  But ... not sure where to start but here goes: lukewarm water in the shower (at best), toilet got blocked, gray/thin towels, uncomfortable seating, bathroom floor floods when using the shower, the door lock had to be fixed, in-room safe did not work and it's too far from everything.","Images":null,"When":""}]

Oddly no night lamps or light switches next to bed. Bathroom was perfect. Hot shower, good lighting and a hairdryer! Location worked for us.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"BOON_NH","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed in this hotel from 5 to 7 Nov 2018. The staff have been very helpful and efficient.||||After a quick check-in at midnight, the staff also run through what were my itinerary during my stay to see if I needed any help with my trip in Mandalay. Despite the short notice, they were able to make the arrangement as per my plans.||||I also requested the hotel to help me with booking of bus tickets. As my preferred bus company does not accept phone booking, they went to extra mile to go the bus office to help me make a booking and collect the ticket. All of this was done while I was out sightseeing. They also offered a lift to the bus station as the bus company does not offer hotel pick up.||||With my bus in the night, the hotel was kind to allow me to use their staff facilities to have good shower and wash myself clean before my onward journey.|| ||For their efficiency and helpfulness, I give this hotel and its staffs two thumbs up.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Lindsay B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I'm very late to write this review - however I would like to say just how fantastic the staff and managers are of this hotel.||The first thing I would like to commend them for, is for their understanding and hospitality to my partner and I at breakfast. We were in the dining room, with a room full of a large chaotic tour group. They could see we were uncomfortable were very accommodating personally to us, to ensure we had everything we needed. ||Secondly, I left my yoga mat at the hotel after I departed Mandalay for Bagan. The hotel found my yoga mat in my room, and posted it to me to a Myanmar address, so I could receive it back. I'm from the UK currently backpacking around the world, with no base or long term address. The mat is not an easy thing to post itself, let alone timing it so I could receive it in time. They made it happen! ||Huge praise to be had for the management and staff of this hotel. They went out of their way, and should be commended. |","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Esther Y","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcHdm0oAuHtzPwzcwUtTqUfPbZXmYnyyN78cO7_Z2aHVLpBkIuu0olTbSpOuQZcPV9sYQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Basic hotel that has a clean toilet and bed.
