title: Shwe Ingyinn Hotel (SIG) Hotel
address: Corner of 30th & 78th St, Mandalay
descriptions: Upmarket hotel offering relaxed quarters, a restaurant & a rooftop bar, plus a spa & a gym.
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Robclayson","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My wife \u0026 I stayed here on our travels through Myanmar in March. Our check in date was 10/03/19 \u0026 checked out 13/03/19. The entrance to the hotel is to the side under cover \u0026 the the luggage handlers were all to keen to carry our bags in. Met with the usual fruit drink (cold) which on the day was very nice as it was climbing past 38 Deg C when we arrived. Check in was smooth as we had vouchers as part of out private tour operations. Usual Passport scan \u0026 they were handed back. Escorted up to our room \u0026 the facilities were adequate. All I ask in a room  are three things in SE ASIA: A/C Cold-yes, Hot water-yes \u0026 Fridge cold-yes. The rest really is minor as most of the day you're out and about anyway. Room is quite large in comparison to usual size \u0026 the bathroom is bigger too. There is a in room safe, TV, WiFi is good, Bed is standard Asia offering (firm to hard), floor not to slippery in Bathroom after shower. || Elevator was a little bit on the slow side sometimes but for a large hotel like this it has only one so just be patient. Breakfast is a standard type with both Asian \u0026 Western choices available. I spotted the coffee machine on the first morning of breakfast \u0026 asked if I could pay for a coffee \u0026 it was not problem to the staff. it was all good until they ran out of beans on the last morning. oh well, two out of three aint bad. We had two dinner meals there over our stay \u0026 they where fabulous. They even let us have a table out on the balcony of the restaurant \u0026 while we dined the sun went down over Mandalay City. They are building a roof top bar set up on the roof of the hotel \u0026 when that is operational. It will be a great place to sit up there \u0026 have a few drinks. The roof top has stunning views of the city \u0026 surroundings. We had a free day on our last day there \u0026 hailing a tuk tuk to the main market was easy. In the the afternoon I used the Spa facilities \u0026 had an Awesome Thai body massage \u0026 foot massage. All the staff were very helpful \u0026 any requests where met with \"can do\" attitude. The restaurant staff did an excellent job attending to our meal requests. As all mentioned above, the hotel \u0026 staff do a really good job.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Filip S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcoKrjftg2H5FSPDgamEji1HcAj6KJIMYEaB28IfM5URISpFokTGJ4TKCMmdB7Et-p_0g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We were pleasantly surprised at the size, cleanliness and overall quality of our room here. For the rate, it is a great value. The staff are very friendly and the location (right across from the train station) is quite central and makes it easy to tell taxi and tuk-tuk drivers where to take you. The breakfast wasn‚Äôt great, but still plenty of choice and healthy (eggs, yogurt, fruit, cereals, breads and a range of Myanmar cooked dishes). A great place to call home while in Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Mark Robinson","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWJvIH6ZCawVxP5MfFLvKdnD-s_pXR1leomr7Dv6svwbZVnrfZy=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Stayed here for two nights, on two separate occasions. Lovely quiet Hotel, with the exception of a little traffic noise, but then that is to be expected as it is in Central Mandalay. Nice clean rooms. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Has a good breakfast buffet. Convenient location for sightseeing and visiting local shops, the railway station and the markets. Booking on line gets you a cheaper price than just turning up and booking a room. Would stay there again üòÄ","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Victoria Li (Su Mon Aung)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUcIar_bwzTWObcYyhlmS62r4hfpPRHc30NhPtTF7JUQkO6YTovTg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We get free upgrade to our room and it's superb. Comfy, clean and spacious. Like the interior design and room planning. Didn't get the chance to have proper breakfast there but the bread they gave us to eat on our way is nice. Much appreciated.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"penelope_pit_stop123","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfzjVLsS8e-67WTk0n2dtmoLvjFzQd1pnSZl8AzVxF0EXF41tQWWb2Gu3UnsT1rmBrWdQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed only 2 nights here. Our room was spacious with a big hard and surprisingly comfy bed and pillows. We slept soundly on both nights and were only on floor 4 next to the busy road, but we couldn't hear it. I give this hotel only 3 out of 5 because when we checked-in the receptionist was grumpy, the room wasn't thoroughly clean and breakfast was disappointing. If I returned to this city I'd stay elsewhere, somewhere that has a good restaurant because there aren't that many good clean restaurants in this city.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Andreas U","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed for one night coming from the Shan State en route to Bagan. The first room they offered was a smokers room which a loot of parfume applied too very the smell. We got another room without any discussion which was far more better, clean and huge, so nothing to complain here. However the hotel lacks any atmosphere. The breakfast is definitely on the downside - very poor. There are better hotels in Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"David L","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed for 4 nights in November.||I had a large and spacious room. The bed was nice and comfortable, excellent pillows! The bathroom needs updating and the shower was cold 2 out the 4 times I used it.||The staff were very friendly and helpful.||The breakfast was ok, but limited in choice, I think it was geared more towards the Asian clientele.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Theingyi M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The staffs are very friendly and polite. The room are clean but lighting is a bit on the darker theme. Breakfast is good but would like to see a bit more Myanmar traditional breakfast as most of the breakfast item are Chinese and European. Overall I had a great stay with my family.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Yadanarpon Dynasty Hotel
address: No. (B/413 65th Street Between 27th Street and, 28th St, Mandalay
descriptions: Simple rooms & villas, some with balconies, in an unfussy hotel offering dining & a rooftop pool.
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Pyae P","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Stayed at 3rd floor during Mandalay Thingyan Holiday. Room is spacious,clean,well equip. Bed and linens are clean and comfortable. Bathroom is clean and equip with bathtub. Bathroom amenities is decent.Every room in front side with balcony and nice place to see surrounding. Pool on the rooftop is a bit small and very hot.Breakfast is decent but Asian foods always have to wait for replenish. Staffs are friendly and attentive especially the security team members they even wash our car. The only downside is Air-con !!! Yes Air con !!! Not enough cooling power and M&E team did servicing of the air con but no improvement at all. Tried to change room but fully booked and no other room left.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Bonn B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfHhPp0vyvo1Wo3WY4NH1G5QOPAHGBMv_XiebXLZtHzVwVa3wkRhb3dykyKrUCZPlawDA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel has been my fav hide out place since 2016 but now the standard has dropped so low that I am really disappointed. I used to stay every weekend and even the hotel staffs recognize me. But now my fav hotel becomes the worst. The furnitures are not cleaned properly, the bath tub is  leaking that I couldn‚Äôt even use it the water I filled are all drained. The shower pipe is also leaking cannot even shower in peace. And Some of the lights are out which make me feel spooky. And the worst is the mosquitos. I couldn‚Äôt get any sleep at all last night. When I complained to the reception, they didn‚Äôt even bother to give their apology. Anyways Thank you very much for ruining my getaway I wasted my time and money.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Yan Seng","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLJtO0uMSVHTbG2V85qXAuIEilZvxBB5nElbWQHSuj2wB7Ag-mc=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Wait up at 6.30 am and go to rooftop pool side to enjoy December morning view of Mandalay. The moat and old place, Mandalay hill, tree, mist (or else) splash with early sunrise is heaven. It cool December morning.

The pool are nice ( very cold for morning dip)even it only 4 ft deep. It local pictures point from this pool.

The hotel itself seem a bit dated, cleaning can be improve, nice toiletries should be provide. Reception staffs are OK. Breakfast staffs seem overwhelmed with guests and services  can be improved a lots. At least smile. Food was below Mandalay hotel standards with that price range.

Will I stay again?

I would love to enjoy morning view again. Would not be my first choice overall.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipN8dkwQkRGU6yWT_0BVk5vkfaJ6wiHKi6sY2v-l&fid=0x0:0x77f37fbb07509976"],"When":"2018-12-25"},{"Name":"JontyCheshire","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Great place to start our trip in Myanmar, central location which gave easy access to local restaurants. Hotel staff friendly and very helpful, we stayed in a lovely villa that led up to the hotel and it was quiet despite it‚Äôs location. Breakfast was good too which set us up for the day. Rooms clean and the drinks were not over expensive in the hotel. Only downside, they stop serving drinks at 10 so you have to resort to mini bar which isn‚Äôt overly priced and whilst we are not heavy drinkers, it‚Äôs nice to have a night cap especially when you are 6 1/2hours difference.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Robin S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be perfectly nice. Room was of a very decent size with a decent bathroom and a nice view from the window. The rooftop pool was good for a refreshing swim. Breakfast was adequate. Location handy for restaurants and a short tuc tuc trip to the hill.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ambra S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"From the outside the first think is ‚Äúwow very nice‚Äù.. the problem is when you walk in... |staff do not speak fluent English, the building inside has old furnitures and not very clean standard. |Our room in particular (1st floor) was full of mosquitos and we had problem with the shower (If our friends next door were having a shower at the same time we couldn‚Äôt get any water)... |breakfast is ok, just very crowded. |A part from that the hotel is located in a nice position and within walking distance you can find restaurants where to eat. |For the same money you can definitely find something better","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Choong H","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeYuXGoFc9HnT35lAJ46cKDIsHY7nNIKUKz_f8yINNlqyrU48jCx-4ctPzihRKgde030w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"It is located in quite nearby to Mandalay Palace, but you need to walk quite a distance if you were to enter via the main entrance gate of the palace. The hotel is relatively good, room is clean, wifi is okay in the room, but I do not like the washroom, as the shower place is an open place in the bathroom, hence it will wet the whole room when you take your shower, not unless you shower in the bath-tub. Breakfast is okay, except. they do not serve that enough fruits. During my stay, only banana and papaya were served, and both were to ripe. The mohinga served was quite good. They have a pool with a nice view if you have the time to enjoy. Front desk service is quite good. If you were to come from the airport, you may take airport shuttle van, and they bring you directly to the front entrance of the hotel.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Treasure","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUA0bwqQVjtQbe6sqFx07Bg3YzEWo3GUWLT95Qaf2ybss5-aGYM=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"I stayed a 3-day trip there, very quiet and relaxing for me. Also nice view and clean atmosphereüíï.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Hotel Hazel
address: 53rd Street, Between; 36th & 37th Streets, Mandalay
descriptions: Polished rooms in a high-end hotel with a bar, a restaurant, an outdoor pool & free parking.
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Richard Thein","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKHfami5DwwZKhan-Lv9rXG1Yw0ebP8sBUvkEBvKBk3mwvo7xo=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"The rooms and hallways stink of cigarette smoke even though \"no smoking\" signs are everywhere.\nLots of foreigners here which is all good by itself, but a significant number of foreign guests are very uncivilized. Just on my first day I saw multiple foreigners from a specific country use the emergency stairwell as their personal smoke lounge. The same group of people also spat all over the stairwell.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Than K","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I checked in Hotel Hazel from 5th to 8th June 2018. I have to thank the front desk staff as they were so helpful as in arranging taxi and always smiling. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows were like clouds. The amenities they put in the room were excellent like the super comfortable bathrobes. Lets not forget to thank the housekeeping staff who did all the work to keep the rooms clean and tidy. The internet was great on the first day‚Ä¶ however it slowed down a lot on my last day there. ||||Breakfast was amazing. You have the very talented egg station chefs who will cook made to order eggs. They have wide verity of foods from European to Chinese to Myanmar dishes. Well the outstanding person I met during my stay has to be the Duty Manager, Mr. Nandar Aung. He‚Äôs ever so friendly and knows how to converse with guests. That is important in this industry because it shows that upper management do care about customer satisfaction. Well done. I‚Äôll defiantly check in if I am in Mandalay in the near future.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Amit Morey","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW0dX3u7z7IJKs3YXF2d587jw3BStlbozdTLk19NDvU7aDP8lc0=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Highly recommended! Hotel is world class! The hotel is maintained extremely neat and clean! The staff of very friendly courteous. Rooms are spacious! Breakfast spread is huge and tasty. Had a chance to meet the Owner and she is very polite and nice to talk. She takes personal interest to ensure the guests are comfortable.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Wai H","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcKrc8e2JnTu8c7_hmoZKea10RMTDbKaR4QZbjFBwR43DXTBpqzkG_SGZrLD47rFdkvjQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Rooms are quite large. Feel comfortable. Room service is very good. Foods taste good. But dining room is small for such hotel. The room is full during high seasons. Bar is small. It's usually empty. Swimming pool is ok size. It's open roofed but situated between tall buildings. So, it's shady almost all day. The hotel also has meeting rooms for business trips. Has car parking. |If you are going just to relax, it's a nice hotel. It's a little far from downtown. Getting here and there is quite difficult. But there is a 24hr convenient store 5min walk. So, you can stay at hotel all day, stretching your body, laying beside pool and drinking cocktails.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Christopher T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeYuXGoFc9HnT35lAJ46cKDIsHY7nNIKUKz_f8yINNlqyrU48jCx-4ctPzihRKgde030w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Stayed at this hotel on 3 occasions in March/April 2019.  The hotel entrance / foyer is impressive but the rooms and corridors are tired and in need of a makeover.  The hotel appears to cater largely for bus tours - breakfasts can be very busy, but lunch/dinner was taken in an empty restaurant. Food is acceptable but far from exciting.  Staff are excellent.  The hotel is far from the centre of Mandalay - some drivers find it difficult to locate.  It is impractical to get to the centre other than by taxi. I f you want somewhere central this is not the hotel to stay at.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Dianna D","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Rooms super modern, breakfast has a huge selection, free cocktail in evening. Pool looked nice but doesn't open until 9AM so could not try a before-breakfast dip. A little out of town, a little tricky to walk to anywhere for dinner (dirt streets and no street lights), but if you have transportation and nice quiet resting spot.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Hotel Hazel Mandalay","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXYwowXX_zU3DH_tDk4KpfksA5x790q7LkzzbfV00cgjVpJlIDe=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Specious room which is nice and clean. Full of facilities. Service is good. It is lovely that is tea or coffee is complementary ( if you are in love with them ). Food are also good but expensive. Swimming pool is also big enough. Chlorine is not that much, water temperature is also good. Excellent hotel. Match with their price.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Shweta Mehta","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKnBNPP5Ue-oK0APgZcyg7chCCjEBkPVWMA9MmkgeIvqNf8HQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"My family had a good time during our stay in hazel. They welcomed us with mango drink and we were offered free drinks. Seems Swimming pool is not cleaned for a long time. Breakfast buffet offers Myanmar and continental items which gives a good option to foreigners.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipPc6GIfyQwCkOh4DLAUGFSRhR3jjwh4T-zJYnp7\u0026fid=0x0:0x8a4ed1dac8dba1c"],"When":"2020-1-7"}]

title: Mandalay City Hotel
address: 26th Street, Between 82nd & 83rd Chan Aye Thar Zan Township, Mandalay
descriptions: Unassuming hotel featuring an outdoor pool & a restaurant, as well as breakfast.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"26th Street, Between 82nd \u0026 83rd Chan Aye Thar Zan Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"TringWirral_England","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeCck1CfANpZm9bBk3PHtP97Kh9k25HZfvq9yAWlN3BaIyjSHUPEfWkhAJmuYiJsH-_6g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Stayed here for 6 nights in late January (sorry this is late).  The first impression was a bit of a shock as we were in very good hotels in both Yangon and Inle, but we appreciated the hotel and it's location much more as our stay progressed.  We chose a more upgraded room which had a comfortable seating area and coffee table.  We had booked through the hotel and found that very efficient.||||As we got to know Mandalay better, we realised a lot of hotels are in very noisy positions as it is a big, bustling city, so quite rightly we had been advised to choose this one when I had asked on the forums for a quiet hotel.  The service and food was also good, so no complaints - it was more Mandalay which we were not too keen on.  We were able to walk to a local street market which was very interesting as it was not a tourist market (staff can advise how to get there - they are very helpful).  We also used a car/driver suggested by them for excursions on three days.  His name was Mr Bob and he had a big modern minibus, so it was quite a bit of luxury for just two of us and his prices were good as well.  He took us to a couple of restaurants, one was very good, the other not so much.||||Overall we enjoyed our time in Mandalay as there is quite a lot to do from there, but we would have liked a better pool area as it was very small and shaded with a lot of overhanging trees.  The trees could have been cut back to improve the area considerably.  We ate in the hotel most evenings and found the food good and well priced.||||We also found a very good laundry not far from there (but not very near either).  It was called Laundry King.  I had a skirt washed in the hotel once and it shrank a bit, so would not suggest using the hotel laundry service.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"AnneF56","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed one night at Mandalay City Hotel and found it very clean and comfortable. The single room was fairly small but more than adequate for a night‚Äôs stay. The pool area was lovely and I loved the plants around the pool and at the entrance to the hotel. We had dinner at the hotel that night and it was fine,  but not brilliant. Any shortcomings of the hotel were more than made up for by the friendly and very helpful staff.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Y√® P","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_hSEOVyYt90T8jEI1lbdGPaVqSrwdtGLOma43xF2tT-AGCQEDWJCQ3qq81gsm_HjiWg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The former highway complex turned into a cozy and classy hotel in the busy areas. It is quiet and nicely decorated with a good swimming pool. Rooms are not large but clean and comfortable. The breakfast is good too. The staffs are fantastic. Will definitely stay there again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nolan Wright","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLz6suMcNipXDbs4VFTKyVhI0nQ-yhmLLYCChUpc321xgtHiQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"It is an oasis is the middle of a crazy city! The road just outside is super busy, but you don't hear it at all from the hotel. The room was pretty tight for 3 people, but for 2 it would have been perfect. That WiFi was good, the bathroom and shower were great! And it had a great location too. I'd definitely recommend anytime stay there!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipOyW5eUZFf64xr96OOEECiKmMkK6X3IiWjuSbsS\u0026fid=0x0:0xb0a5c14a6d721ca7"],"When":"2018-11-19"},{"Name":"Gus Ferguson","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUMhuygeEZ5fFBwa6Fp_vbsj5a4TQR6UwX4LxAu_Sgdxy1rtqpxZA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"We found this an OK hotel. Value for money.\nStaff were friendly and helpful.\nNote the lift does not go to each floor, just the stairs between floors. But staff are helpful with baggage.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jonathan Lee","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIOoyBdh7fRjeMOX7hy_q58zzKX9--VlejwzPiYasUBxdHzqAni=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"A surprisingly modern and amazingly clean hotel, hidden from the main streets. Breakfast was also pretty good, with quite a large selection available.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jezza A","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Hotel was clean and fine for a one off stay in Mandalay. Hotel was not in a great location as had to get a tuk tuk to restaurant but this was not a problem. Reception staff were very helpful.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Duy Khiem Vu","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJP5XzJmSoc2FoBmN5BabIM5y5iG-iIKvyjn-9Kv0-gvKiZDA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"nice hotel. large rooms and bathroom. staff is super friendly and helpful. housekeeping staff very helpful with carying our suitcases. waiters at the breakfast are very helpful with getting your food without being intrusive. always smiling and well trained. good hotel, i recommend. only silly that elevator stops halfway the staircase, so you still need to carry a few steps.","Images":null,"When":""}]

address: No. (1), 26th (B) Road, Between ; 55th & 56th Street, Aung Myay Tharzan, Township, Mandalay 11221
descriptions: Relaxed rooms in a casual hotel offering an outdoor pool, a restaurant & a gym, plus free breakfast.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No. (1), 26th (B) Road, Between ; 55th \u0026 56th Street, Aung Myay Tharzan, Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"11221","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Lois E","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I really enjoyed my stay here because the staff was so helpful. They provided a map and gave me good information regarding sightseeing. The hotel lent me a bike to pedal around town and all attractions were within close proximity. My room was enormous and included a huge bathtub. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. I enjoyed the nightly dance performance, which was free of charge.   There were a number of longyi available for sale in my room, I picked up two of them at a good price. I would recommend staying at this hotel.  I enjoyed eating dinner here, the food was great, particularly the tea leaf salad.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"prashant v","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfzjVLsS8e-67WTk0n2dtmoLvjFzQd1pnSZl8AzVxF0EXF41tQWWb2Gu3UnsT1rmBrWdQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I have stayed many times during my Mandalay business trip. descriptions: Airy rooms in a relaxed property featuring a rooftop infinity pool, a poolside bar & free Wi-Fi.
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Julie D","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My husband and I spent a week at Hotel the Haven and really enjoyed the property and the location even though it is not in downtown Mandalay. The room was really well decorated and we had a small balcony looking out over the entrance of the hotel.  The room size was excellent and the shower very spacious. The breakfast was very good and there is a bar on the top (5th) floor by the pool where the view of the sunsets was amazing. Food is also served there and we took advantage of that on a couple of occasions.  ||The staff was very helpful and helped us to arrange a car for our drive to Bagan. ||It is necessary to take a taxi or a tuk tuk to most sites and restaurants but the prices were very reasonable. ||We would definitely recommend this hotel and encourage others to try it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ivar G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfsnvlNO8mgROWsxiGYBmc-FMApm47le01WrNgEyYNYqUPw1j7nx-COV-HLlhXF8VUXQQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I rearly give hotels a 5 rating, but this hotel deserves it. The room are really big and shining clean. There are coffe and tea at the rom, and also a working safe plus a fridge. The rooms also have an exelent place for the suitcases. The staff is topp and arrange tours, car, almost everything you ask for is provided.||Breakfast and other meals are good. And on top of the building is a small pool with a good view, a bar and sunbeds. A very airy place during the hot Mandalay days and nights. ||||The hotel is located in a silent side street, a bit away from the senter but closer to The Mandalay Hill, which was important for us. Bu the way, there are aleays Tuk-Tuks outside the hotel. ||||Some people would find the beds a litte bit too hard, but we all found them fine.||Wi-Fi is a little slow as in all Myanmar.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"JohntheTravellr","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Awesome place - very new, clean and exceptionally helpful and informative staff that went out of their way to help where ever they could. Hotel had an amazing roof top pool and bar where you could look over the city. This alone was worth it. Very nice breakfast and hotel is well located to everything - we often walked but easy to get a Tuk tuk. Only 5 months old and was booked out for 2 nights we were there for a reason. We are a couple but a lot of people had kids staying at this hotel which was well catered for. Highly recommended best hotel we stayed at in Myanmar.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Yvonne W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_hSEOVyYt90T8jEI1lbdGPaVqSrwdtGLOma43xF2tT-AGCQEDWJCQ3qq81gsm_HjiWg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed 3 nights in a deluxe room with a balcony (4th floor).  The room was large and comfortable with an amazing shower.  Breakfast was good and so was dinner (tasty food, reasonably priced - a nice, lazy option after the whole day of sightseeing). Great views from the pool area.  The only slight disappointment was lack of wardrobe / storage cupboard of some kind - living out of a suitcase for 3 days was a bit tedious - 4 hangers in the bathroom are not enough. And the room is certainly big enough.  I would stay there again, definitely.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"James Bushell","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJOTnIfib5UOhm4Zv2UlAhF_Icxgzc0UAOIlDQ3Kw00kw2cSw=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Really impressed with this hotel.

Didn‚Äôt expect much when booking it but turned up and was very impressed. Staff from the very second of arriving was very accommodating and helpful. Spent time helping us plan our couple of days there.

The rooms are spacious and clean, far exceeding the standards of Myanmar hotels. I personally cannot fault anything about the hotel and their staff.

I haven‚Äôt stayed anywhere else in Mandalay but after staying here, I don‚Äôt think I would consider trying somewhere else.

Lovely rooftop swimming pool and decent breakfast in the morning.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Gavin T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdHDxxyBDO6igPA51sqxYAI1TTeuGvapT1sWSCJfPSgzOZltNlMhWmUDpj2A3v7zAw89g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My wife and I enjoyed our one week stay here.  The hotel is aptly named because it is tucked away near "Ye Sit Kan" (filtering pond) close to a residential area, yet easy access to downtown and major attractions in Mandalay via tuk tuk or taxi.  The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were nice, breakfasts were good with attentive staff, the rooftop pool and restaurant were also nice with great service and amazing views of the city, sunsets and Mandalay Hill in the distance to the north.||||The best part was the outstanding service from the friendly staff who helped us arrange a car to drive us down to Bagan.  When we got to Bagan, I realized that I lost my lens cap somewhere but didn't know where.  The next day, the hotel staff in Bagan informed me that Hotel the Haven called saying that they found my lens cap and that they would have it delivered to the hotel in Bagan from Madalay.  Now, that is service!  I think the name of the employee is "Ma Hnin?" who handled this, so thank you very much Ma Hnin!  To the hotel management - please consider this my commendation of Ma Hnin for her excellent customer service.  In the grand scheme of things, the value of a lens cap is insignificant, but the lengths that Ma Hnin went to demonstrates how much she cares about her hotel guests and it goes a long long way beyond the cost of the lens cap or the delivery cost.  Many thanks again, we will definitely stay here again.||||My only suggestion for this hotel - please consider expanding traditional Burmese dishes on your restaurant menu and breakfasts.  When we are in Mandalay, the heart and soul of Burma, we really want to enjoy Burmese food (of course, we understand other guests may want other cuisines also, but a few more Burmese dishes please, thank you in advance).","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Katherine K","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I stayed there in October 2019. Everything was fine except one thing. That‚Äôs why I took quite a long time to write this review. ||Room- Spacious||Elevator-working||Swimming pool- very nice||Location- It is not on main road. So, some taxi drivers find it difficult to find. But this is manageable. You‚Äôd better get a visiting card from the hotel.||Trip to Sagaing- There was one problem with this hotel but this was because we were dumb. We asked for suggestions about visiting Sagaing to one of the staff as a day trip to Sagaing is very convenient from Mandalay. So, that staff member arranged a car for us for a fee of 70000 kyats($50) for half-day travel. Later, we learnt from a local chauffeur that it was way more than it should have been. It should have been about 25000 kyats($18). |So, if you travel to that area, do not rely on staff. You can use Grab app to get a car to travel around or call a local car hiring service.||Otherwise, I‚Äôll recommend this hotel for your visit to Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Maria Adams","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJgCv09tXYl4wJPNk_fpspBhaGywlZXm0maOlc9H23vDhnvgQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Pleasantly surprised!

The location was good, located just a short drive away from northern Mandalay and most of the attraction. A beautiful lake view from our room, plenty of tuk tuks and taxis just outside. Yet tucked away from the noise of the city.

Restaurant served a pretty comprehensive menu for decent prices and they extended the full menu to room service which was great. The complimentary breakfast was quite good as well with a-la-carte eggs, coffee, and tea served along with a buffet of Asian and western options, breads, and juices.

The room is what really surprised us, much larger space than the photos show. The layout is very optimal. They have blackout curtains and shades. A nice long bench for baggage keeping the living space clear and free. A definite great value.

The rooftop swimming pool was beautiful, with an infinity pool looking over the city and a nice set of tables, though food service closed way too early. The lobby offers plug in space and plenty of comfortable work areas. AC throughout the rooms and common areas, well functioning elevator and facilities.

Overall a great stay for anyone visiting at any length of stay!","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Golden Hotel

descriptions: Refined hotel featuring casual rooms, plus apartments with kitchenettes, as well as free Wi-Fi.

title: Ayarwaddy River View Hotel
address: Between 22 & 23 Street, Myo Patt Rd, Mandalay
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Khant Win","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUA1RQh7mTshiyhdkAooC6jW2vl-WcRvvIzQtaUkrlnHHLQLVgS=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I recently stayed at this hotel, and it left me with mixed feelings. On the positive side, the room was quite spacious, offering plenty of room to move around, and the view from my room was quite enjoyable. The staff members were courteous and provided convenient service throughout my stay. Another plus was that I never experienced any power outages, ensuring a comfortable stay.

Moreover, the hotel's location is excellent, with several good restaurants nearby, making dining options easily accessible. Additionally, the pricing was reasonable, offering decent value for the accommodations.

However, one aspect that didn't quite meet my expectations was the breakfast. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the standards I had hoped for. Overall, it's a decent hotel with some strong points, but improvements in the breakfast department would make it a more well-rounded choice.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipOOD5u8Wa4aCaFEu-xJm_W4srAUkiifL3Husc0z&fid=0x0:0x5d685f66f32169f4"],"When":"2023-9-1"},{"Name":"Richard G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The Ayarwaddy River View Hotel was the first hotel we stayed at in Myanmar.  After a lot of travelling to get there, we just wanted somewhere to relax.  We found the Ayarwaddy River View Hotel was terrific - they were so welcoming and friendly, it was the perfect place to stay.||||We stayed in a suite, which was a really big room and had plenty of space for us and our two children - there were two big rooms, plus a bathroom and a good sized room for putting our bags in.  The room was airconditioned, had two bar fridges, a safe and TV.  The bathroom was a good size and clean.||||The view from the roof bar/restaurant was excellent - watching the boats chug up and down the river and just to relax.  Food was a bit slow at times, but we were never really in a hurry.  The roof bar got busy around sunset, so make sure you're ahead of time if you want to get a spot looking over the river.||||The breakfasts were delicious, which always made a good start to the day.||||The best thing about this hotel was the service.  They went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and it was never any trouble for them to help make arrangements for taxis, day trips etc.  The service here was the best at any hotel we stayed at in Myanmar - it really makes a difference.||||The hotel isn't located close to a lot of sights, but that's the trade off for the river view.  Taxis aren't expensive, so we never had trouble getting around.  It is nice and handy to the tourist jetty if you're doing a day trip to Mingun, which we did.||||The other terrific thing about this hotel was the refillable water bottles.  Each guest had a glass waterbottle, which you could refill at various spots around the hotel.  Such an excellent idea, because so many small waterbottles end up in the rubbish in Myanmar.   More hotels should pick up on this!||||The hotel also has a pool and there is an ATM right out the front of it, which was super handy.||||All up, it was a great hotel to start off our trip to Myanmar.  I'd definitely recommend it to others.  It also felt like you were staying in a hotel in Myanmar - it isn't one of those bland, corporate hotels that could  in any country round the world.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"58tho","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeWB0GIG9gGd6g9zDFXwjE9TRuKRtAO6HvwA5jEdK_CrOJXcVxp8esjQRYTFMjay2JK=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I had a fabulous time here.  The hotel room was a little on the tired side, but to be expected, but clean and comfortable.  The staff at the hotel were exceptional.  Pleasant, helpful and happy.||||The food here was delicious.  I ate here for 3 nights and never had any problems and breakfast was plentiful.||||The hotel overlooks the river and it also has a lovely rooftop bar, a lovely place to relax after a busy day at sunset.||||||All in all I would recommend and definitely stay there again.||||It was my first time in Burma.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"A No Grainer","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUJiUyss8_C5t5GkMZDI2t_k5js6nBYGTcc4sLXRAS42RRwWGRo=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Spectacular views from the roof, this is the ideal place to watch sunset in Mandalay. However, the restaurant manager made us feel very unwelcome. We arrived to a roof top of totally empty tables and were told that every single one was reserved so we had to sit in the corner without a view. However after 1.5hours none of the tables had been filled. Considering we only went for one drink it would have been nice for them to accommodate us and let us use one of the many free tables until a time when the guests that had reserved it arrived.
Cocktails are average for the price but worth it for the view.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipN356mA6gLbtokr08MDPAUmPAQfWriUXr9tEgsv&fid=0x0:0x5d685f66f32169f4"],"When":"2016-11-15"},{"Name":"Kristen H","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We had a fantastic stay. Our room was large and comfortable, and the hotel amenities were quite nice. There's a lovely rooftop bar and restaurant, a great spot to take in the sunset over the river and to enjoy happy hour (they have specials each night). It has great proximity to the river, but is a bit out of downtown. That said, it's easy enough to get a tuk tuk or taxi to go out at night.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Alex Gunter","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUH2f4HDQCbQaxhWbozOPJNj64dwPjwa2KDWSOxXTj0pYzRqjbV=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Clean and nice rooms and great service. Good air conditioning and bathrooms.
Friendly and organized reception
Comfy bed and pillows.
I would recommend this place if you are going to transfer onto the ferry the next morning
Very decent hotel restaurant as well.
Happy hour from 5-6 on the roof top bar. And a marionette show ( if not raining) as well.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNNRZ5aqr64FkmzwBsADkBSbW2PrjyXYQD5u_bp&fid=0x0:0x5d685f66f32169f4"],"When":"2017-10-12"},{"Name":"Gerry S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdHDxxyBDO6igPA51sqxYAI1TTeuGvapT1sWSCJfPSgzOZltNlMhWmUDpj2A3v7zAw89g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Very nice hotel overlooking the river. The rooms are comfortable, the top floor sky bar is excellent and the staff go out of their way to help you. The location is good and good taxi services available to take you around.||||Breakfast is poor for western tastes though.||||Venus on reception was magnificent. She helped me with my appointments and organised my itinerary. Fantastic service from a  dedicated person. Thank you, Venus!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Peter Hecht","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJMvq5tUK4-g_lIK1m5PGT6clbcQK82YGAMzoyd0KoikgjRng=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Very nice hotel with attentive staff. The room was very large with a huge bed!  However, the A/C workings is very strange.  After you put your key card in the slot you then have to wait 7 minutes for the A/C to start.  So you have to sit sweating buckets for it to start it's countdown - very uncomfortable as it seems to take forever for the room to cool down. So every time time you leave your room you go through the same rigmarole.||This hotel is full of Chinese tourists.  Breakfast was a fight to get a table and food. In room furniture are conformable.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"KyawPar Ggyi","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJg3IdmiPlMsQeZdImC_-eIWuVBp3lK5ArALxibKeP3fSRFOsA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"You don't need to refer too much, when the service arrives, you will want to rest on site at HaVaNa","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipOZY7K0JwbUb9Uf158uMxv181b9aqbMCfvLUcAJ&fid=0x0:0x68ae5c0b6b4671b0"],"When":"2024-7-28"},{"Name":"San San Yin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUdaeYiqA3WpNKiAJ2uZ58K4iLtsJXKMrnJj3mNwjddal4O0H4=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I've stayed in numerous hotels in Mandalay, but none of them equal to this one.The room service was excellent, and I enjoyed the downtown view.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nyan Lin Htun","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIGSYmt2-WQv6AvVQen7RL2fGysZCN_SXVsaf-OrI9ojjo7IIM=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Hotel layout, Breakfast is all convenient. It is a satisfactory hotel in Mandalay","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipMA8iFQ9mR2-HL6Ym9dbte1fm5MNCkrIlQ-jGmv&fid=0x0:0x68ae5c0b6b4671b0"],"When":"2024-4-6"}]

title: Hotel Shwe Phyo
address: X3JF+JR3 Hotel Shwe Phyo, 87th St, Mandalay
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Nilar K","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeNj0UTN0yIrCGyJ0JhWwDODOg5QjAH0gdfB9Ji-oFl0zWFI-YVmhNAr-FGLycdpIjFmw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After a pre-booked prolonged stay at this Hotel, the following conclusions were reached:||||Positive: Staff \u0026 Management were friendly. View of Eindawya Pagoda and Sagaing Hills from the breakfast room on the roof top were good. The Room was reasonably clean.    ||||Negative: Staff receive little or no training or support from management \u0026 are too few in number during the high season to do their job properly, eg room servicing, proper cleaning \u0026 maintenaince. If a problem arises, management is likely to disappear \u0026 leave the Receptionists to flounder around with an inadequate command of English whilst the Guest becomes evermore frustrated. Consequently there is a high turnover of dissatisfied staff. Additionally communication \u0026 record keeping between Reception staff is often poor, resulting in Guests thinking an arrangement has been agreed, only to find that a later Receptionist on duty either has a different record to the one agreed, or no record at all. This particularly applies to travel arrangements made from the Hotel, Laundry handed in at the front desk, previously agreed Bills for staying at the Hotel \u0026 arranging to stay a few extra hours after check-out-time, all of which should be routine stuff.||Regarding Food Hygiene: Breakfast cutlery and plates are left exposed for 24 hours to dry on a table in the open air on the roof top while lots of pigeons wander around the tables \u0026 surfaces defecating.  The washing-up is obviously done in one go without changing the water, as the cutlery always had a greasy film covering it. The toilet on the breakfast roof top area is opposite the kitchen and kitchen staff using it have been observed not washing their hands in the sink provided nearby. ||||On various occasions we offered to give Management suggestions as to how they could improve their service, but these were cheerfully rebuffed, presumably on the basis that most of their guests never stayed more than a day or two, so the guest/problem would soon disappear forgetting that we are now in the age of online reviews.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Saw M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This is my second time to mandalay and very nice choose. I do not expect a high quality customer service at this Hotel Shwe Phyo but fortunately I seen a best service at this.||Rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is very nice and so many items to choose.||Especially at the front desk staffs are very polite and helpful. The lady at the front desk, Ms Htet, especially well known in customer service. She arranged for me everything what I want. Surely, I will come to this hotel again when I arrived to Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Uli T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QenZcshuv-mcTaHpijHYR7rD8aAfHNd_sW64kn-Y5YjDT8OPIb2-VibdC_Ge2Xr-2EV5A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"A good place to see the daily busy life of locals. And not to bad to start tours to the country site.||||The name sign on top of the narrow but tall hotel building is well noticed from a distance. this is very helpful after sunset due to the partly dark streets around the hotel ( keep torch handy).||Even if you received a City Map, it would be helpful to have a GPS on your Mobile, since not all signs of the numbered streets are visible in the darkness and landmarks to remember are rare.||||By booking one of  the very small rooms, it would be an advantage to take a Twin, since you can use (as single) the second bed to place your belongings.  A/C is a bit of a problem, because you almost can not adjust it. ||||The hotel is situates almost in the center of a large market area for fruit, vegetables as well for all kind of goods.||But it is very difficult to find a kind of restaurant here, since the people feast on street food or local nudel soup shops.||A bike (free of charge at the hotel) is very helpful to explore the area. ||The highlight of the hotel is the location of breakfast area on the 5th floor (no elevator), since you have a great view over the city (almost better than from Mandalay Hill).||Unfortunately they won‚Äôt win a trophy with the careless presented breakfast (wet crockery and cutlery placed also for self service on a table), Continental with eggs ‚Äì if you know it, you can ask how you would like them,  dried out sausage pieces and two simple local (cold) dishes, some fruits. Surprisingly you get fresh milk for your coffee, if you ask.||The rest of the staff at the reception is very friendly and helpful, but they don‚Äôt speak well English, except the manager.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"carys d","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QejddW0yoGeT8LnCjh-OGQgsf6YKqhof3HZA5-um4yCkQej85oCdMUmKPJmnowcu5Ag5w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This hotel was a bit hit and miss. The room was clean and breakfast was Ok but one day the room wasn‚Äôt serviced. There was no evening restaurant service or bar. Staff English is limited but all were very pleasant.||The thing you most need to decide is if this is the location you want. The hotel is situated by a huge city market in the full hustle and bustle of downtown and about an hour walk from Mandalay hill. Street food abounds but it is quite far to more Westernised restaurants. We used the restaurant in the Aurora hotel just up the street.||If you want to experience the real Myanmar, this is a great experience. If you want a little less street chaos and a more central location other good options abound, including Ned Kelly‚Äôs.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Martin Mercerun","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVLt5eE6aoaR_ksemLOQLBso72_yLVwWfAKMu0CKaLzL8FaGds=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"We had some problems with the water at the bathroom. First there was not hot water then there was not water at all. Later the water problem had been solved. Staffs do not speak English very well. If you ask something the answer is always 'YES'. So you can not get any tourist information from them. We spent 2 nights there but no one took the rubbish away from the bin. Breakfast could be more varied.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipM4TY25fw6Qy4_4PBguk_sW4goS-LaCSmJbIBWp\u0026fid=0x0:0x68eb84a14eba852e"],"When":"2018-12-9"},{"Name":"Louise","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUCXOEypfVdDG2vyJT094SWRN7rK2t-O0CHT5Iv34TYC9hZP3dfow=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We paid $13 a night for a double room which was extremely good value for money given the great service, clean room, good breakfast and free bicycle use. The only slight negative was the overwhelming number of staff, it probably wasn‚Äôt necessary to have 8 people greet us in the morning in the reception!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ch√≠ D≈©ng Nguy·ªÖn","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX4b1fL9qtsg6sUwsypBBIf17rTZolWfyimv-ukFvidFuJp3ENU8g=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Very helpful and friendly  staff. We hired 2 double room for 2 nights. They offered us free bycicles to tour around and showed us what we need to know. The breakfast was still served for us at 10.30 when we were late from Ubein Bridge. Thank you.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Steve Allchin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU9nUUR50j9yF8tu20T5U7l-AODV5saAekA2HalGSf24iaDKhe0=s120-c-rp-mo-ba7-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Lovely helpful staff but they can only work with what they have. Needs updating,  wifi was bad and not much English spoken. Location is very very noisy from the street and temples as they play everything through loud speakers from 04.00 - 12.00.","Images":null,"When":""}]
