title: Hotel Mega Star
address: 80th Street, Between 8th Street & Strand Road, Aung Myay Thar Zan Township, Mandalay 11101
complete_address: {"borough":"Aungmyaythazan","street":"80th Street, Between 8th Street \u0026 Strand Road, Aung Myay Thar Zan Township","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"11101","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Suzanne W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeFH6dzZjd_ZFLhXHZKibEzXEy8hWzFB4Qa7PutLe3CnO2G7yVfjd4VSabiCQwQYo5W-g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The staff on the front desk were so helpful and arranged onward journeys and trips for me and my husband. They also organised taxis each night to access restaurants which were too far to walk to.  The hotel also has complimentary bicycles which we used to zip around Mandalay. My husband liked the room and it was very clean. However, on a less positive note, we did not feel that this hotel is quite the oasis we thought it would be.  I saw the monkey only out of her small cage once and that was when I encouraged the staff to let her out.  It made me feel quite sad.  However, we weren't there all day and so Jewel may have had run of the garden at these times - I do hope so.  The views from the dining area are great - but there was no ambiance at all.  The staff were again very friendly but we found breakfast disappointing.  On our last morning there was very little to eat at all.  We had to ask for fruit, we had to then go and ask for bread and then again ask for eggs.  We were brought glasses of water and offered tea or coffee admittedly but that was it. The room rates were very reasonable but even so, you shouldn't have to literally search for your breakfast.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Yukiko G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qc_hSEOVyYt90T8jEI1lbdGPaVqSrwdtGLOma43xF2tT-AGCQEDWJCQ3qq81gsm_HjiWg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Through reading the reviews (on both Trip Advisor and Agoda) and having seen the  photos, we were really excited about our booking with Mega Stars. I was looking forward to a little swim in their beautiful pool and to a quiet, comfortable stay whilst we explored Mandalay. (We are a well travelled couple in our early 40s taking a year long break from our working lives and backpacking for 3 months so far, and were looking forward to a little bit of luxury for a few days.)||||Unfortunately we arrived at a hotel that seemed to be mid refurbishment - we even wondered, as we walked in, whether they were open for business. (They insisted they were.) The \"garden\" had been cleared out and was bare (no plants or animals as described, just concrete and a layer of dirt with minimal garden furniture). The pool had dirty water up to an adult's knee with children's toys floating inside. There was personal laundry and more toys thrown across the lobby, with dust and dirt on the floor as we entered the hotel. The ashtray was full of cigarette buds and water and didn't seem to be cleaned for a while. It is currently low season, so perhaps they just didn't expect anyone. Nobody seemed to care about the state the hotel was in. ||||We had booked for 4 nights and really hoped our stay would improve, but sadly it didn't. Unfortunately it really was one disappointment after another. To their credit, the room was clean, lovely and comfortable, but I would hardly call the hotel's services even a 1 star, and the continued disappointment just made the overall stay a frustrating and underwhelming experience. ||||- Location: It really is quite far from everything in Mandalay (at least 2kms to the NW corner of the palace moat), so make sure their bikes are working or plan to rent a motorbike / install Grab on your phone.||||- Cleanliness: They never seemed to clean the hotel (reception, garden, pool area, etc) for the duration of our stay. The kids toys stayed where they were, unless the kids moved it. There were 2 dogs roaming around throughout - assume they were being looked after by the manager or staff. They were cute but seemed to have fleas...! (I like dogs, but inside the hotel building?)||||- Bikes: All rental bikes had flat tyres the first night. They hadn't been serviced at all. The hotel staff couldn't fix it for us for our first night due to lack of tools. To their credit, 2 were fixed up  the following morning and were in rideable condition, albeit old and clunky. Call them beforehand if you expect to use them!||||- Pool: The boy behind reception said they were cleaning the pool and that it would be ready the following day. No cleaning seemed to be done for the duration of our stay whilst the manager/staff's kids played in the dirty water and made a lot of noise. Their toys remained in the pool. It was non operational for guests. FYI the swimming pool is in the hotel lobby as you walk in and is more like an oversized bathtub, so don't expect to have a swim if you're an adult and check beforehand that it's working if you're expecting a dip.||||-Staff: They didn't seem to have a lot of staff on duty and they didn't speak very good English. They were nice but everyone in Myanmar that we've met so far has been absolutely lovely. So nothing exceptional from the hotel staff and we were disappointed by their lack of care overall.||||- Garden: Not even worth mentioning at the moment. It was just some garden furniture on dirt. Not sure if they're re-doing it, I would hope so for their sake!||||- Room: We stayed in the delux double and the room is 3 star, to their credit. Good amenities, working air-conditioning, Internet, clean towels, a comfortable bed with clean sheets. They have a bathtub with a power shower (European style!) with hot water. Unfortunately though, their safety box was broken, the satellite TV did not work and the fridge broke down on our 3rd night. We also had to ask them to refill the coffee and water on arrival as they were not re-stocked since their previous guests. ||||- Breakfast: Assume this was massively scaled down as we seemed to be the only guests staying in the rooms. We were given some toast, 3 slices of cheese to share between us two, jam (which was actually quite tasty), a choice of omelette or fried eggs, fruit (an apple, sliced) and coffee everyday. I had seen photos of their continental breakfast buffet, so was thoroughly disappointed. We were given a make shift table next to the dirty pool and toys.||||- Serenity: Perhaps this was due to the lack of other guests and us staying during the summer holidays, but the manager/staff's kids were shouting and playing until the late hours (midnight) in the lobby and the garden. I had to make a complaint as we couldn't sleep one night.||||I really wish I could have written a positive review but unfortunately this was not the case. The hotel was nothing like the photos or description, except for the clean room, but even that had issues. ||||Overall, Mega Stars has potential and could be a lovely place to stay, and perhaps during high season it raises the bar. They were probably expecting a group on the day we left, as suddenly, overnight, the pool had been cleaned and filled and they had swept and cleaned. It felt like a slap in the face for us. ||||Beware if you're coming during low season, as it seemed to turn into their \"home\" and definitely not ready to accept hotel guests. I felt like we were in the way and couldn't have been happier to leave. I would hardly call this place a 3 star based on our stay and consider it unrecommendable.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jon B","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qdx0CtChWdL4amzhVtedU6JgNzs3A9KzPS8K998c7-u-mDeTb-7WQwuTD-PPX6BcVA5wg=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"As ever the hotel staff were courteous, accommodating \u0026 helpful.|A pity the hotel DOES NOT deliver to the information/description given on either Agoda/Booking - there was no hotel bar/restaurant at all. There's a pool but its really not very inviting.|Given the remote location it was a long way to find food - 1.6km, all the way down to the nth side of the Royal Palace (12th street).|However, there's a \"Dagon beer station\" opposite!!|We booked a deluxe (pricier) room but were shown to the smaller superior (cheaper) rooms at first. This was quickly sorted in a friendly manner.|We took rooms 103 (dbl at rear) \u0026 106 (dbl at front) both were decent. The front room was noisier but not excessively so. Rm 106 was bigger \u0026 had a larger indoor seating area that was more comfortable.|Contrary to some reviews our rooms DID NOT have mosquitos but there were \"some\" outdoors (as you would expect). They were not a problem to us.|Breakfast was fine \u0026 plentiful - eggs, toast, tea, coffee, jams, fruit and .... french fries, spring rolls plus an Asian option - noodles/rice/congee/chicken sausage etc.|The hotel provides bikes for free - a good few are pretty good too. The roads are a bit tricky after 4pm rush hour \u0026 after dark - fun but not for the faint hearted!|Taxis are not as cheap as Yangon eg hotel to east palace gate MMK5,000.||Summary: a decent stay, manager was great ...it just needs its own restaurant!!!|","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"226O226o","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeWB0GIG9gGd6g9zDFXwjE9TRuKRtAO6HvwA5jEdK_CrOJXcVxp8esjQRYTFMjay2JK=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The Owner and Staff at Hotel Mega Stars couldn't do more to welcome and help their guests. They provide welcome drinks not just on their guests' first arrival but on every return to the hotel at the end of each day.||||The owner Htun is always personally available to guests to make them feel at home, and encourages a spirit of generosity in his staff. Htun is personally excellent with kids: our two, a boy of 7 and girl of 10, absolutely loved him. He is also part of a small team of players of the national ball game Chinlone / Caneball who not only play a nightly game in the hotel garden - which is absolutely riveting to watch - but also invite guests and their children to have a go, and it's not easy to play!! ||||The hotel restaurant food is beautiful: a nice mix of Asian veg and meat dishes, noodles and some sensational \"finger fish\" and fries: battered fish fingers and English-style chips, which were great for our fussy western children! The breakfast is good: cereals, lovely brown bread (to counter the prevalence everywhere in Asia of slightly sickly sweet white bread), eggs and some Asian breakfast options such as rice, veg and noodles. Most amazing of all about the restaurant is the view of misty Mandalay Hill which is to die for. The swimming pool is pleasant although we didn't use it much as the evening temperatures in December when we stayed were relatively low and the water was a little cold: it would be great in the hot season months from April to October.||||Probably the jewel in the experience of staying at Hotel Mega Stars is the presence of \"Jewel\", the resident monkey, who is a sweetheart. At first we came with our Western preconceptions of \"is this animal safe?\" and \"is it right for there to be a wild animal kept in a cage in the garden?\" In fact, Jewel is a rescue monkey whose mother was killed by hunters - she is free to roam, and as and when she wants to, she enters and leaves her large garden habitat which is surrounded by netting and shared with some very gentle and friendly rabbits. Yes, monkeys and rabbits get on like a house on fire, we discovered! Jewel swings around the trees of the garden and amazingly, she recognises instinctively those guests who are into hugging monkeys and those who aren't. We read another review that stated that the rabbits have made the place extremely dirty - this is totally inaccurate. In fact, the whole hotel is extremely clean - on one morning when we were in a mad hurry to leave, we left our room in an absolute state ...not only had the staff come in to make the beds and change the towels but they had also carefully folded all our clothes for us!||||Our children loved Jewel - she is very domesticated, and runs up to those who put their arms out to her, acting like a big baby, snuggling in close for a hug. Probably for the presence of Jewel alone, but also because of Htun's warmth and kindness as an owner, our children will never let us visit Mandalay again without staying at Hotel Mega Stars. ||||In the interests of offering a balanced picture, I'd say the only small negatives - all of which were far outweighed by the positives - were the slightly limited WIFI which at present (December 2016) is available in the lobby only but Htun the owner is fighting hard to have a proper hotel wide broadband installed in early 2017, and will I'm sure succeed in this goal; the distance from town is longer than some other hotels at 15-20 minutes by car, but actually, taxis are cheap and easy to come by (5000 kyats or US$5.00 from town) and I must say after the very busy days we spent in Mandalay, it was a very welcome break from the noise and bustle of the city to get a little way outside at night; the only other thing was that the temperature of the water in the shower was quite hard to regulate - it took some time, a few minutes, for the hot water to arrive, and then if anything it had a tendancy to be too hot and hard to turn down. Perhaps some thermostat-type taps would help with this. None of these things are reasons not to come to Mega Stars: not at all.||||We spent our time in Mandalay working in a school for disadvantaged children and Htun offered a gift to the school at the end of our stay of plants from his beautifully cultivated garden.||||Overall, the hotel is a very happy place where guests' suggestions are taken very seriously as Htun is keen for his establishment to be the best hotel in Mandalay. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Anne M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel due to the nice space in the garden and well equipped rooms . The breakfast is a bit disappointing and service not great but the staff are very helpful and are trying . There is an indoor pool which is quite small but nice to cool off in at the end of a warm day .Free bikes are also available.||The downside is the position of the hotel as it is too far to walk to any of the restaurants and any trips out require some form of transport or using taxis .","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"santunoo","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeSe9ibNVY65MpgeQh70I370foM0-7tEPyVc9CIfSq5Ekli093sZJVPBoLD5d5qPK_2rw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I had a nice chat with the owner today. He told me that most hotels in Mandalay need to cater to Chinese clients in order to make money. That means opening massage parlors and karaoke rooms on premises, entering into business relations with Chinese businessmen who get their money through shady means, and generally compromising one's principles just to stay open. But being a family man and a devout Buddhist, the owner has refrained from doing any of this. It does hurt his profit, but he is able to sleep better at night knowing that the guests are not exposed to these negative elements.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"wim s","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qcx7DtSIuJI9UJU1ybYoEA6i_uOe_F9V6dOnYVPO8gBdo0k23EJlyGd0YO4_LmJhQZKEQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"\"Although I am a pretty one, as a dog I am mostly not welcome in hotels. But my boss found out about Hotel Mega Stars and I really feel like a VIP here. The staff are great with me and get me food or look after me when I need to be alone for a while. Then I also made some new friends here: there is a monkey which' mother was killed by a nasrty hunter when she was a tiny baby and who was rescued by the owner a year ago; she lives here now all the time: lucky her I say! Then there are some bunnies too. I must admit, I had some bad thoughts about these bunnies - when I get hungry, you know - but then I get my four paws back on the ground and realise they too should be able to enjoy their stay. So for all of you who like a home away form home and a comfy bike to ride around Mandalay - I walk of course but I heard a lady say they are comfy - do not hesitate: this is the place to check out and check in! I wish more places would be so welcoming to all creatures great and small...like me that is. Thank you Mega Stars people!\"","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kyawt M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The owner is very friendly and staff were helpful and courteous at all time. The location is quite far from downtown but quiet and close from Mandalay Hill. The pool is indoor, and small. The internet connection was so bad.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: ËøúÊñπÁöÑÂÆ∂ Landmark View Hotel
address: 26th St, Mandalay
user_reviews: [{"Name":"Daw Khaing","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVCyDFb8kPSloFCtsJa3ZTkaXdgW_myH04AS_JlK8GoCDC9GoDm=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"A great experience .The staff always worry about you being comfortable and they do their best to help you anything.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile\u0026image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNGN353j8gUtxDQcRNSEBgWFKCRew4Y9VJ_1cCC\u0026fid=0x0:0xd977da55c0eb5870"],"When":"2024-11-11"},{"Name":"miha h","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QftlnsLB8VReEIa8q3x-FUIWL9jAVnw9OiPzFml0xLx7k1DporKgZdMXGALflbNzntF3w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"After having checked out several Mandalay's cheap options that were terrible we randomly found this hotel. The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. Our room (double on the 5th floor) was small but neat, very clean and functional. Breakfast wad ok, I prefered the Myanmar style noodle soup with freshly prepared fruit platter every morning. Grear value for money.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Linda C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdVsxDWqDDLG62Q3M3dmLlHORJs5jz0NWRJO3cP21KtRNPfosO7RpofjnbUgpyNjOTDew=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The room felt new, clean and pleasant.  If you have any mobility issues, you should know that there are quite a few stairs to get to the lobby and more to get to the elevator.  They will carry your bags. They arranged a good car and driver for my sightseeing and sold me a ticket for the boat to Bagan for the same price as is advertised.  I didn't see anywhere nearby that I wanted to go to for dinner so ate in the hotel.  The food was good but take something to read while you wait for your order.  My only real complaint was the last morning I has to leave very early so tried to make myself an in room coffee.  Worst I've had anywhere.  Apparently the powder contains cream and sugar.  I like my coffee black. This stuff was so sweet and horrible that I had to throw it down the sink and have green tea instead.  Maybe instead of putting two of that undrinkable stuff in the room, they could put one of those and one with nothing in it but coffee.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"EnClair","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QcHdm0oAuHtzPwzcwUtTqUfPbZXmYnyyN78cO7_Z2aHVLpBkIuu0olTbSpOuQZcPV9sYQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Great location, big rooms, bathtub, hot water, ok breakfast, fast wifi (almost streaming quality) and a great bed. Even the pillows were not to hard.||The price is a bargain for what you get.||Staff is super friendly.||Any negative? As usual in this region, windows are single glazing, so it sounded like the cars were just beside the bed, but our room was on the back, so it was not to bad at night. We slept fantastic.||Ok tv within cnn and hbo","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Pedro F","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qd0Gzx7-o-W0qn7F-oHhorx-ann6UFYRniBmE7Ar1MhRFtO-x6vY7U2LNCPC1lcQidkpw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Hotel with good location and warming and friendly staff. ||Hotel have elevator but to to reach it you have to beat two paths of stairs, one to the reception and another to the elevator itself, anyway if have luggage staff will help you take it until the room. Hotel itself is a bit old but the most annoying thing is that they located the laundry at top floor that works during the day, starting early morning and if you stay in the top floors as was our case, is impossible to sleep well...  even after we moved to a lower floor (3rd) we still could heard the machine working and at lower floor notice the room have double layer window for better soundproofing from the street.||Staff are very helpful and can support providing many activities in the city as free cycling, renting e-bike, providing transport around the city and to Amarapura. They also helped book transportation to Bagan.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Zwillingsseele","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qcacbd8SUzOZ5BFqcuH0dUXFfPFzIfRWlhBQfTV3kcVPU69oUP_k10j49o8svvEcoldiA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I did not expect such a cute and charming hotel in the middle of the city. The rooms are very cosy, Internet is free and they offer a huge breakfast. The staff is really nice and wants to help you all the time. The restaurants nearby are not that good, so I tried the roomservice which was really delicious.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Michael M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed here twice, for 3 nights each time, over a period of 3 weeks, and overall were very happy with our stays.||We booked deluxe rooms and chose to have rooms at the back as they are quieter because of the street noise in the front rooms.||Speaking of which, we noticed that the windows in our rooms were not closed properly when we checked in; so if you do stay here, double check them because it‚Äôs significantly quieter when the windows are shut properly.||The beds were very comfortable, not hard like some beds in the region can be.  There was a minibar and two free bottles of water per day.  Some rooms have laminate floors, some have carpet, which tends to get dirty quickly given the dusty/muddy condition of the streets of Mandalay.  The AC worked very well and the hotel has a back-up generator.  There is an elevator, but as others have noted, you still need to climb some steps (maybe 10?) to get to it from the lobby. ||The internet was generally ok, though a few times it seemed to get very slow, but if you waited 5 minutes or got out and then back in it was fine again.  They have a computer you can use in the lobby and if you need something printed like I did, they had me email the document at printed it up for me at the front desk for no charge.||The bathrooms were a good size, clean and fairly modern, with an electrical outlet which makes it convenient to use an electric razor or a hair dryer - this was missing in many of the other hotels we stayed at in Myanmar.  Another feature they had that is often lacking in Myanmar hotels is a shower curtain, so we were happy about that too!||One reason I chose this hotel was because I wanted something fairly central, and I was pretty happy with my choice.  It‚Äôs within a few minutes walk of a few decent restaurants and some of the interesting sights of Mandalay, but the city is spread out so no matter where you stay you will probably end up taking a taxi and/or hiring a driver and car for the day.  ||On that note the hotel provided  very competitive rates and a very good driver for us to go to Sagaing/Inwa/Amarapura one day and to Pyin oo Lwin another day.  His car was comfortable, clean and he wasn‚Äôt afraid to use the AC, though unfortunately, like most vehicles we were in in Mandalay, there were no seatbelts in the backseat.  Fortunately he was a very safe driver and we had no mishaps caused by other less cautious drivers!||Breakfast at the hotel was ok, they cooked eggs to order, offered bacon on alternating days, had some type of fruit every day and bread/toast.  They also had Asian breakfast food.  The one thing that was missing was yogurt.  They offer breakfast packs if you have to catch an early boat to Bagan or an early bus/train.||We used their laundry service, they charge by the item, not by weight, but the prices were not exorbitant, roughly 400-600 kyat per item, and they did a good job of it.  ||The two young women at the front desk with whom we interacted the most were very helpful and spoke quite good English.  For our second stay we arrived very early in the morning by bus from Inle lake and the gentleman working the front desk overnight gave us a room right away, which was very much appreciated.||For the price we paid we thought it was good value, comfort and service.  I recommend this hotel without hesitation, as long as you can manage a few steps to/from the elevator.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Andres F","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Basic hotel close on the center. Nothing special, normal rooms that need be renovate, specially the bathroom, hot water didn't work very well. The windows are very thing so is very noisy. The staff even if smile is not very efficient. You can see them rest in the sofas at the lobby or just on the phone, english skills not very good so you have to explain more than twice some basic things like confirm a pick up. Didn't have BKFST there after see the coffee station on the lobby. ||The hoytel mention a Sky Bar, that's a joke, seriously. I supposed a normal roof top with some stools and tables like in the pics, but seriously that was totally sad and depressing. Went up stairs, lights off, then a guy lay in the bar. Lights turn on, and surprise, was the laundry area. With the washing machine there. Even the view was good. ||What I said, just for one night, arrive there late and check out early.","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Hotel Aurora
address: No.190, 87th Street Between 26th Street and 27th Street Chan Aye Thar Zan Township. Near Zay Cho Market Mandalay, 05023
descriptions: Straightforward hotel offering a restaurant with a rooftop terrace, plus free breakfast & Wi-Fi.
complete_address: {"borough":"Chanayethazan","street":"No.190, 87th Street Between 26th Street and 27th Street Chan Aye Thar Zan Township. Near Zay Cho Market Mandalay","city":"Mandalay","postal_code":"05023","state":"","country":"MM"}
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Orie S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfCm-MBS7Itwd4h-55xcyygsVKq1IZbUTNyg17UKkQsT2C3oSXBlQ_-pGTl8imnrFVtVw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We enjoyed 2 nights of excellent service at Hotel Aurora. The staff were extremely attentive, friendly and helpful throughout the hotel with great English language skills. The rooms are small but clean and well air conditioned. Each breakfast was a huge spread of both local and continental options, all delicious. Served in an open air terrace on the top floor, it was a great and hearty way to start the day. In the evenings the area turns into a lounge and with open views of the city, it was a nice place to cool off with a drink before heading out for dinner. Although we did not eat at the lounge, the food served to others looked fantastic. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to the Mandalay Moat. I would recommend a stay to others without hesitation, especially if you are looking for customer service that goes above and beyond!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"wendy b","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qcx7DtSIuJI9UJU1ybYoEA6i_uOe_F9V6dOnYVPO8gBdo0k23EJlyGd0YO4_LmJhQZKEQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Really great little hotel. Clean white bedding, clean modern wet room, safe, friendly helpful staff and nice roof top restaurant. Really pleased we booked this hotel [twice for both stays in Mandalay], very good price too. The staff arrange our site seeing tour with a taxi driver for the whole day, plus our journey to the airport, nothing was too much trouble. The food in the restaurant was good in the evening, although a little hit and miss at breakfast [little things like running out of food and having to wait some time for the replacement meaning the rest of your breakfast is cold, oh and not heating baked beans, I don't think they realise they should be hot, but never mind].||I would definitely stay here again great little place. ||Nice free cocktail each night too, nice little touch.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kasia W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"We stayed in Hotel Aurora for 3 nights. We arrived by boat from Bagan and it was a short 10 minute taxi ride to the hotel from the jetty. The check in staff were super friendly and spoke great English. We needed to get bus tickets to Kalaw and they booked them for us straight away, we paid for them together with our room which was very convenient. We had the room 208. It was perfectly adequate for a short stay, I would have liked something bigger if I was staying longer as there wasn't much space to unpack. The bed was on the hard side but we personally like it that way so worked for us. The bathroom had a lovely rain shower and was a wet room. The restaurant is on the 4th floor and is a partially covered terrace. The breakfast was nice, similar to other budget hotels in Myanmar, mostly Asian options, egg station, toast, jam, fruit etc. Coffee could do with an upgrade and be hotter but I wasn't expecting it to be amazing judging by other places in Myanmar. We also had lunch and dinner there and both meals were tasty and ok price wise. We had one day to see the main sights and the hotel suggested the best way of doing this - hiring a taxi for the day. It was a very good value suggestion, ¬£27 for the whole day. The driver didn't speak a huge amount of English, just pointed out what the attraction was and how much time we had which worked fine for us. The hotel also got a taxi to take us to the bus station on our last day. Very efficient service, great attitude, super friendly staff, I would really recommend it for your stay in Mandalay. I believe we paid around $80 for 3 nights so a real bargain!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Olivia Pino","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUf3SmDmq7uxYYGIGX08-prUw585t2Ym78FUogOP_yU4uzxSMYlsg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"This hotel was amazing. Starting with the unbelievably kind and helpful staff with excellent English. The hospitality Is at a 5 star hotel level. The breakfast was also delicious and plentiful. The views from the rooftop are amazing and security is excellent. This was also my only hotel room in all of Myanmar where I did not have a single insect anywhere in my room. I stayed at a 4 star hotel the previous night for 3x the price but my stay here was so much better. Amazing value for the stay. Will definitely stay here again when I am back in Mandalay","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Cherry On The World - Travel blog","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUDmYT29RoQyxrEfi2vsJroXwVMM6rBdfXYQc-lJX6GD9TraKiA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms and bathroom.
Free cocktail everyday at happy hour.
Breakfast was good with a nice view of the pagoda nearby. The restaurant is situated on the rooftop with a nice view of sunset and sunrise.
We recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to visit Mandalay. Good value for money!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Alistair W","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfjHmZg8gr7jpDgKhrh5KsR_Mq7L6pkVedvpKQz-f3LMiOd3OjI90CK4uLtF3wE59zZgA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"For a budget hotel this was a very comfortable stay. ||The front desk were always more than helpful whenever you had any questions.||Breakfast was good, fresh-made eggs any way and good food for dinner as well. The rooftop bar/restaurant is a nice place to relax after a long day sightseeing.||The room fine and the bed was more comfortable than some beds in the region.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Mark M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"The hotel is nice for a budget hotel.¬† The staff was friendly and spoke excellent English.¬† They helped us figure out where to go and arranged a taxi for a full-day private tour around the region.¬† The room was rather basic with a somewhat hard bed. The bathroom featured a wet shower.¬† Breakfast was about what you expect for a budget hotel.¬† Given the hotel‚Äôs price, friendly staff, location and other available options, we would suggest this hotel to others.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Geoff T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdHDxxyBDO6igPA51sqxYAI1TTeuGvapT1sWSCJfPSgzOZltNlMhWmUDpj2A3v7zAw89g=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My girlfriend and I only got to stay here for one night during our travels but the hotel has been great. The room was decent for the price and the breakfast was good but the stand out thing about this place was the staff, they are so friendly and helpful and helped us plan out travel destinations as well as booking stuff for us. Not only that they let us leave our bags there during the day and when we came back to pick them up allowed us to use the shower to freshen up before our next leg of travelling. Highly recommended!","Images":null,"When":""}]

title: Ibis Styles Hotel Mandalay
address: X48G+W2M Ibis Styles Hotel Mandalay, 35th St, Mandalay
user_reviews:
[{"Name":"Preston Kunz","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWioqZhUaCR6lM-5uTkJ75BuUPHrDD1-cOb3RDbDdAWNO3QmJkq=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"FOREIGNER BEWARE!
Chose another place to stay if you can. I'm so upset with this hotel. I'm a foreigner living in Myanmar in this difficult time.. how does IBIS receive you? By charging you close to double the rate just for being a foreigner.

This is common in a lot of hotels around Myanmar but I confirmed over the phone that by presenting my FRC and Form C that they would give me the local rate.. they still would not honor their commitment and charged me almost 500,000 per night. when locals pay around 250,000.

I will never stay here again.

Staff were friendly, and room was clean. If you want to pay double for having white skin stay here.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Dbkildare","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qczn4VDfUM6-AtEt-6oaNazFa-i9Fy6kqPVfGIlPil6vJulEYyK8t930jZwOW4hD80mzw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This has all the advantages of an international chain hotel but with the most charming and helpful staff that you would normally expect to find only in a small, family run, place.  So, really, the very best of both worlds.|Extremely comfortable bed, 24 hour electricity, excellent breakfast and a great bar beside the pool...(the bar on the roof is separately owned and managed and has more of a noisy night club vibe, but is still nice for a drink at sunset.  There is also a great Japanese restaurant about twenty steps from the front door if you want a break from Burmese food..|The staff here went out of their way to make my stay, of about a week, really enjoyable and hassle-free.  I would definitely stay here again the next time I am in Mandalay.  Thank you to all the team at Ibis Styles!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kaung Sett M","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QdCjMUwIiBikRhCLHgN_0vyGAo1GvT8DEukiKQb1ujC_eFsFjYrQ0OvLoSxPtqmCdgvFA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"All the staff was warm and welcoming, provided a fantastic experience with their F&B offerings and hospitality. Swimming pool was a nice place to chill.|The rooftop bar was a standout, offering breathtaking views of the city making it a great spot for a relaxing evening.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Zaw Wann","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXx7CWogNht0ThAZKyy6YGgAOodCmOnqge2JRMlSC2jDftBKe4=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Spa service is very bad üò±
Foot messager is not well trained and not professional although service fees is taking as international fees.( 3 times than Local spa service fees)","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Maung Maung Kyaw Thar","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUnYvt86cIWcxHV6p22kDfJKBZBQF1cR5d9Q5lFTUmWbMJzfX02xw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Need more restrictions on smoking in the rooms . Room facilities are required to add more facilities","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipOm1kc5atQpymvjWja5iwBRERS0FPsqiKYMT-dL&fid=0x0:0x35c54ec4dec522c8"],"When":"2024-12-26"},{"Name":"trin 17","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUfDovuEAdggZ7D9o1mFGwQBTeHiy4AK0MfNRjA16yjxtUU3kPq=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"First time to this new hotel opened less than a year ago. Not in mandalay city centre but still an okay location with few restaurants nearby.
The front desk ladies at check in were polite and helpful especially the courteous one conversant in mandarin. All other service staff such as bellboy, housekeeping and cafe were also hospitable especially the kind, helpful poolside bar staff and gym staff.
Rooms had a good city view and were comfortable, modern and clean as were the bathroom. The wifi was above average but can sometimes cut off as did the power but i doubt this intermittent wifi/electricity was the fault of the hotel.
There is also a modern gym and an adult pool, not huge but sufficient for laps but due to it not being indoor, the water was super cold. ü•∂
Best part of my two night stay was the nice breakfast buffet with western and local dishes. Nice local noodles, tea, latte, pastry and eggs made to order. Their choice of western dishes was also good such as their steak dinner.
Due to our event in their ballroom, we enjoyed corporate rates which was decent. However, i felt that their hotel rack rates of above $90 were slightly overpriced.
Overall, i still plan to return as long as i get to enjoy corporate rates but might find elsewhere if ordinary rates apply.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sAF1QipNwcFZ06kEWZLMs7KzTauTBoZwCDFphuvlIJLn9&fid=0x0:0x35c54ec4dec522c8"],"When":"2023-2-9"},{"Name":"Myo T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qf66pF81jsVXBxevYxxL5FsdlDsKAngAUpJVE-hAwai1rl8J0QnYqktKV3UGdpbmNlc_A=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"Clean. Professional Front Office staff. F&B service is so so.  I'd had to ask for coffee spoon where coffee flask was there. Staff did not pay attention to guests in the coffee shop. Had to call to clear the soiled plates. ||||Pool bar was nice. Bartender took care of guests. Drinks were fresh. ||||Gym was there, did not have time to try  it.  ||||Nice hotel to stay in Mandalay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nick Holmes","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVkcHuyNuem7OMpLFZFPSnOarAm1BMUpWSFD2RPDvYjNJElXLU=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Brand new hotel, the reception staff are terrific going above and beyond. They helped with taxis and recommendations. The breakfast was great a nice mix of Myanmar and western. The pool area is wonderful too, although a little pricer than other options in the area.","Images":null,"When":""}]
